text: We're going to pull the country together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We're going to have trade agreements that we enforce.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's why I'm going to have a trade prosecutor for the first time in history.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we're going to enforce those agreements, and we're going to look for businesses to help us by buying American products.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Go ahead, Mr. Trump.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me ask a simple question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's been doing this for 30 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Why the hell didn't you do it over the last 15, 20 years?

speaker: CLINTON
text: No, I voted.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You were very much involved -- excuse me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My turn.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You were very much involved in every aspect of this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you do have experience.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I say the one thing you have over me is experience, but it's bad experience, because what you've done has turned out badly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For 30 years, you've been in a position to help, and if you say that I use steel or I use something else, I -- make it impossible for me to do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I wouldn't mind.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The problem is, you talk, but you don't get anything done, Hillary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just like when you ran the State Department, $6 billion was missing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do you miss $6 billion?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You ran the State Department, $6 billion was either stolen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don't know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's gone, $6 billion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you become president, this country is going to be in some mess.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Believe me.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, first of all, what he just said about the State Department is not only untrue, it's been debunked numerous times.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I think it's really an important issue.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He raised the 30 years of experience, so let me just talk briefly about that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, back in the 1970s, I worked for the Children's Defense Fund.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I was taking on discrimination against African-American kids in schools.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He was getting sued by the Justice Department for racial discrimination in his apartment buildings.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In the 1980s, I was working to reform the schools in Arkansas.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He was borrowing $14 million from his father to start his businesses.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In the 1990s, I went to Beijing and I said women's rights are human rights.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He insulted a former Miss Universe, Alicia Machado, called her an eating machine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Give me a break.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And on the day when I was in the Situation Room, monitoring the raid that brought Osama bin Laden to justice, he was hosting the "Celebrity Apprentice."

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I'm happy to compare my 30 years of experience, what I've done for this country, trying to help in every way I could, especially kids and families get ahead and stay ahead, with your 30 years, and I'll let the American people make that decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I think I did a much better job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I built a massive company, a great company, some of the greatest assets anywhere in the world, worth many, many billions of dollars.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I started with a $1 million loan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I agree with that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a $1 million loan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I built a phenomenal company.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if we could run our country the way I've run my company, we would have a country that you would be so proud of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You would even be proud of it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And frankly, when you look at her real record, take a look at Syria.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at the migration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at Libya.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She gave us ISIS, because her and Obama created this huge vacuum, and a small group came out of that huge vacuum because when -- we should never have been in Iraq, but once we were there, we should have never got out the way they wanted to get out.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She gave us ISIS as sure as you are sitting there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And what happened is now ISIS is in 32 countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And now I listen how she's going to get rid of ISIS.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's going to get rid of nobody.

speaker: WALLACE
text: All right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: We are going to get to foreign hot spots in a few moments, but the next segment is fitness to be president of the United States.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, at the last debate, you said your talk about grabbing women was just that, talk, and that you'd never actually done it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And since then, as we all know, nine women have come forward and have said that you either groped them or kissed them without their consent.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Why would so many different women from so many different circumstances over so many different years, why would they all in this last couple of weeks make up -- you deny this -- why would they all make up these stories?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Since this is a question for both of you, Secretary Clinton, Mr. Trump says what your husband did and that you defended was even worse.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, you go first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, first of all, those stories have been largely debunked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those people -- I don't know those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a feeling how they came.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I believe it was her campaign that did it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just like if you look at what came out today on the clips where I was wondering what happened with my rally in Chicago and other rallies where we had such violence?

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's the one and Obama that caused the violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They hired people -- they paid them $1,500, and they're on tape saying be violent, cause fights, do bad things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would say the only way -- because those stories are all totally false, I have to say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I didn't even apologize to my wife, who's sitting right here, because I didn't do anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn't know any of these -- I didn't see these women.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These women -- the woman on the plane, the -- I think they want either fame or her campaign did it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think it's her campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because what I saw what they did, which is a criminal act, by the way, where they're telling people to go out and start fist-fights and start violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I'll tell you what, in particular in Chicago, people were hurt and people could have been killed in that riot.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that was now all on tape, started by her.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I believe, Chris, that she got these people to step forward.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If it wasn't, they get their 10 minutes of fame.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they were all totally -- it was all fiction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was lies, and it was fiction.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: At the last debate, we heard Donald talking about what he did to women.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And after that, a number of women have come forward saying that's exactly what he did to them.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Now, what was his response?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, he held a number of big rallies where he said that he could not possibly have done those things to those women because they were not attractive enough for them to be assaulted.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did not say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did not say that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, he went on to say...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Her two minutes -- sir, her two minutes.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Her two minutes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did not say that.

speaker: WALLACE
text: It's her two minutes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He went on to say, "Look at her.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I don't think so."

speaker: CLINTON
text: About another woman, he said, "That wouldn't be my first choice."

speaker: CLINTON
text: He attacked the woman reporter writing the story, called her "disgusting," as he has called a number of women during this campaign.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Donald thinks belittling women makes him bigger.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He goes after their dignity, their self-worth, and I don't think there is a woman anywhere who doesn't know what that feels like.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we now know what Donald thinks and what he says and how he acts toward women.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's who Donald is.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think it's really up to all of us to demonstrate who we are and who our country is, and to stand up and be very clear about what we expect from our next president, how we want to bring our country together, where we don't want to have the kind of pitting of people one against the other, where instead we celebrate our diversity, we lift people up, and we make our country even greater.

speaker: CLINTON
text: America is great, because America is good.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it really is up to all of us to make that true, now and in the future, and particularly for our children and our grandchildren.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody has more respect for women than I do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody has more respect...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Please, everybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And frankly, those stories have been largely debunked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I really want to just talk about something slightly different.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She mentions this, which is all fiction, all fictionalized, probably or possibly started by her and her very sleazy campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I will tell you what isn't fictionalized are her e-mails, where she destroyed 33,000 e-mails criminally, criminally, after getting a subpoena from the United States Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What happened to the FBI, I don't know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a great general, four-star general, today you read it in all of the papers, going to potentially serve five years in jail for lying to the FBI.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One lie.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's lied hundreds of times to the people, to Congress, and to the FBI.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He's going to probably go to jail.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is a four-star general.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And she gets away with it, and she can run for the presidency of the United States?

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's really what you should be talking about, not fiction, where somebody wants fame or where they come out of her crooked campaign.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, every time Donald is pushed on something which is obviously uncomfortable, like what these women are saying, he immediately goes to denying responsibility.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it's not just about women.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He never apologizes or says he's sorry for anything.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we know what he has said and what he's done to women.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But he also went after a disabled reporter, mocked and mimicked him on national television.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He went after Mr. and Mrs. Khan, the parents of a young man who died serving our country, a Gold Star family, because of their religion.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He went after John McCain, a prisoner of war, said he prefers "people who aren't captured."

speaker: CLINTON
text: He went after a federal judge, born in Indiana, but who Donald said couldn't be trusted to try the fraud and racketeering case against Trump University because his parents were Mexican.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So it's not one thing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is a pattern, a pattern of divisiveness, of a very dark and in many ways dangerous vision of our country, where he incites violence, where he applauds people who are pushing and pulling and punching at his rallies.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That is not who America is.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I hope that as we move in the last weeks of this campaign, more and more people will understand what's at stake in this election.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It really does come down to what kind of country we are going to have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So sad when she talks about violence at my rallies, and she caused the violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's on tape.

speaker: WALLACE
text: During the last...

speaker: TRUMP
text: The other things are false, but honestly, I'd love to talk about getting rid of ISIS, and I'd love to talk about other things...

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: but those other charges, as she knows, are false.

speaker: WALLACE
text: In this bucket about fitness to be president, there's been a lot of developments over the last 10 days since the last debate.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I'd like to ask you about them.

speaker: WALLACE
text: These are questions that the American people have.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, during your 2009 Senate confirmation hearing, you promised to avoid even the appearance of a conflict of interest with your dealing with the Clinton Foundation while you were secretary of state, but e-mails show that donors got special access to you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Those seeking grants for Haiti relief were considered separately from non-donors, and some of those donors got contracts, government contracts, taxpayer money.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Can you really say that you kept your pledge to that Senate committee?

speaker: WALLACE
text: And why isn't what happened and what went on between you and the Clinton Foundation, why isn't it what Mr. Trump calls pay to play?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, everything I did as secretary of state was in furtherance of our country's interests and our values.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The State Department has said that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think that's been proven.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I am happy, in fact I'm thrilled to talk about the Clinton Foundation, because it is a world-renowned charity and I am so proud of the work that it does.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, I could talk for the rest of the debate -- I know I don't have the time to do that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But just briefly, the Clinton Foundation made it possible for 11 million people around the world with HIV-AIDS to afford treatment, and that's about half all the people in the world who are getting treatment.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In partnership with the American Health Association...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton...

speaker: CLINTON
text: we have made environments in schools healthier for kids, including healthier lunches...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, respectfully, this is -- this is an open discussion.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, it is an open discussion.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you...

speaker: WALLACE
text: And the specific question went to pay for play.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Do you want to talk about that?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, but there is no -- but there is no evidence -- but there is...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think that it's been very well...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let's ask Mr. Trump.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There is a lot of evidence about the very good work...

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's been very well studied.

speaker: CLINTON
text: and the high rankings...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Please let me Mr. Trump speak.

speaker: TRUMP
text: and it's a criminal enterprise, and so many people know it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Please let Mr. Trump speak.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a criminal enterprise.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Saudi Arabia giving $25 million, Qatar, all of these countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You talk about women and women's rights?

speaker: TRUMP
text: So these are people that push gays off business -- off buildings.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are people that kill women and treat women horribly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And yet you take their money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I'd like to ask you right now, why don't you give back the money that you've taken from certain countries that treat certain groups of people so horribly?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Why don't you give back the money?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it would be a great gesture.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because she takes a tremendous amount of money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you take a look at the people of Haiti.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was at a little Haiti the other day in Florida.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I want to tell you, they hate the Clintons, because what's happened in Haiti with the Clinton Foundation is a disgrace.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know it, and they know it, and everybody knows it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, very quickly, we at the Clinton Foundation spend 90 percent -- 90 percent of all the money that is donated on behalf of programs of people around the world and in our own country.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm very proud of that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have the highest rating from the watchdogs that follow foundations.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I'd be happy to compare what we do with the Trump Foundation, which took money from other people and bought a six- foot portrait of Donald.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I mean, who does that?

speaker: CLINTON
text: It just was astonishing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But when it comes to Haiti, Haiti is the poorest country in our hemisphere.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The earthquake and the hurricanes, it has devastated Haiti.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Bill and I have been involved in trying to help Haiti for many years.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The Clinton Foundation raised $30 million to help Haiti after the catastrophic earthquake and all of the terrible problems the people there had.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have done things to help small businesses, agriculture, and so much else.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we're going to keep working to help Haiti...

speaker: WALLACE
text: All right.

speaker: CLINTON
text: because it's an important part of the American experience.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don't want you to help them anymore.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'd like to mention one thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Trump Foundation, small foundation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People contribute, I contribute.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The money goes 100 percent -- 100 percent goes to different charities, including a lot of military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don't get anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don't buy boats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don't buy planes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What happens -- the money goes to them.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Wasn't some of the money used to settle your lawsuits, sir?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, it was -- we put up the American flag.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They put up the American flag.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We fought for the right in Palm Beach to put up the American flag.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But there was a penalty that was imposed by Palm Beach County, and the money came from your foundation...

speaker: TRUMP
text: There was.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There was.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, by the way...

speaker: WALLACE
text: instead of Mar-a-Lago or yourself, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: the money -- the money went to Fisher House, where they build houses -- the money that you're talking about went to Fisher House, where they build houses for veterans and disabled vets.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I want to get into one...

speaker: CLINTON
text: But, of course, there's no way we can know whether any of that is true, because he hasn't released his tax returns.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He is the first candidate ever to run for president in the last 40-plus years who has not released his tax returns, so everything he says about charity or anything else, we can't prove it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You can look at our tax returns.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've got them all out there.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what is really troubling is that we learned in the last debate he has not paid a penny in federal income tax.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we were talking about immigrants a few minutes ago, Chris.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, half of all immigrants -- undocumented immigrants in our country -- actually pay federal income tax.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we have undocumented immigrants in America who are paying more federal income tax than a billionaire.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I find that just astonishing.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I want...

speaker: TRUMP
text: So let me just tell you very quickly, we're entitled because of the laws that people like her passed to take massive amounts of depreciation on other charges, and we do it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And all of her donors -- just about all of them -- I know Buffett took hundreds of millions of dollars, Soros, George Soros, took hundreds of millions of dollars...

speaker: WALLACE
text: We...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me just explain.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But, no, we heard this...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Most of her donors have done the same thing as I do.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, we -- OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what she should have done?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Folks, we heard this...

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, Hillary, what you should have done, you should have changed the law when you were a United States senator...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Folks, we heard this...

speaker: TRUMP
text: because your donors and your special interests are doing the same thing as I do, except even more so.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you know...

speaker: TRUMP
text: You should have changed the law.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you won't change the law, because you take in so much money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, I sat in my apartment today on a very beautiful hotel down the street known as Trump...

speaker: CLINTON
text: Made with Chinese steel.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I will tell you, I sat there...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I sat there watching ad after ad after ad, false ad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All paid for by your friends on Wall Street that gave so much money because they know you're going to protect them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, frankly, you should have changed the laws.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump...

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you don't like what I did, you should have changed the laws.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, I want to ask you about one last question in this topic.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You have been warning at rallies recently that this election is rigged and that Hillary Clinton is in the process of trying to steal it from you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Your running mate, Governor Pence, pledged on Sunday that he and you -- his words -- "will absolutely accept the result of this election."

speaker: WALLACE
text: Today your daughter, Ivanka, said the same thing.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I want to ask you here on the stage tonight: Do you make the same commitment that you will absolutely -- sir, that you will absolutely accept the result of this election?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will look at it at the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm not looking at anything now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'll look at it at the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What I've seen -- what I've seen is so bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: First of all, the media is so dishonest and so corrupt, and the pile-on is so amazing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The New York Times actually wrote an article about it, but they don't even care.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's so dishonest.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they've poisoned the mind of the voters.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But unfortunately for them, I think the voters are seeing through it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think they're going to see through it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We'll find out on November 8th.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think they're going to see through it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But, sir, there's...

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you look -- excuse me, Chris -- if you look at your voter rolls, you will see millions of people that are registered to vote -- millions, this isn't coming from me -- this is coming from Pew Report and other places -- millions of people that are registered to vote that shouldn't be registered to vote.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So let me just give you one other thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I talk about the corrupt media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I talk about the millions of people -- tell you one other thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She shouldn't be allowed to run.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's crooked -- she's -- she's guilty of a very, very serious crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She should not be allowed to run.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And just in that respect, I say it's rigged, because she should never...

speaker: WALLACE
text: But...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chris, she should never have been allowed to run for the presidency based on what she did with e-mails and so many other things.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But, sir, there is a tradition in this country -- in fact, one of the prides of this country -- is the peaceful transition of power and that no matter how hard-fought a campaign is, that at the end of the campaign that the loser concedes to the winner.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Not saying that you're necessarily going to be the loser or the winner, but that the loser concedes to the winner and that the country comes together in part for the good of the country.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Are you saying you're not prepared now to commit to that principle?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What I'm saying is that I will tell you at the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'll keep you in suspense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: OK?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, Chris, let me respond to that, because that's horrifying.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, every time Donald thinks things are not going in his direction, he claims whatever it is, is rigged against him.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The FBI conducted a year-long investigation into my e-mails.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They concluded there was no case; he said the FBI was rigged.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He lost the Iowa caucus.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He lost the Wisconsin primary.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He said the Republican primary was rigged against him.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Then Trump University gets sued for fraud and racketeering; he claims the court system and the federal judge is rigged against him.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There was even a time when he didn't get an Emmy for his TV program three years in a row and he started tweeting that the Emmys were rigged against him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Should have gotten it.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is -- this is a mindset.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is how Donald thinks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it's funny, but it's also really troubling.

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So that is not the way our democracy works.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've been around for 240 years.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've had free and fair elections.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've accepted the outcomes when we may not have liked them.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And that is what must be expected of anyone standing on a debate stage during a general election.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, President Obama said the other day when you're whining before the game is even finished...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Hold on.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Hold on, folks.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Hold on, folks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: it just shows you're not up to doing the job.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And let's -- you know, let's be clear about what he is saying and what that means.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He is denigrating -- he's talking down our democracy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I, for one, am appalled that somebody who is the nominee of one of our two major parties would take that kind of position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think what the FBI did and what the Department of Justice did, including meeting with her husband, the attorney general, in the back of an airplane on the tarmac in Arizona, I think it's disgraceful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it's a disgrace.

speaker: WALLACE
text: All right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think we've never had a situation so bad in this country.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Hold on, folks.

speaker: WALLACE
text: This doesn't do any good for anyone.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let's please continue the debate, and let's move on to the subject of foreign hot spots.

speaker: WALLACE
text: The Iraqi offensive to take back Mosul has begun.

speaker: WALLACE
text: If they are successful in pushing ISIS out of that city and out of all of Iraq, the question then becomes, what happens the day after?

speaker: WALLACE
text: And that's something that whichever of you ends up -- whoever of you ends up as president is going to have to confront.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Will you put U.S. troops into that vacuum to make sure that ISIS doesn't come back or isn't replaced by something even worse?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, you go first in this segment.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You have two minutes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, I am encouraged that there is an effort led by the Iraqi army, supported by Kurdish forces, and also given the help and advice from the number of special forces and other Americans on the ground.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I will not support putting American soldiers into Iraq as an occupying force.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I don't think that is in our interest, and I don't think that would be smart to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, Chris, I think that would be a big red flag waving for ISIS to reconstitute itself.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The goal here is to take back Mosul.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It's going to be a hard fight.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've got no illusions about that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And then continue to press into Syria to begin to take back and move on Raqqa, which is the ISIS headquarters.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I am hopeful that the hard work that American military advisers have done will pay off and that we will see a real -- a really successful military operation.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we know we've got lots of work to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Syria will remain a hotbed of terrorism as long as the civil war, aided and abetted by the Iranians and the Russians, continue.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I have said, look, we need to keep our eye on ISIS.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's why I want to have an intelligence surge that protects us here at home, why we have to go after them from the air, on the ground, online, why we have to make sure here at home we don't let terrorists buy weapons.

speaker: CLINTON
text: If you're too dangerous to fly, you're too dangerous to buy a gun.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I'm going to continue to push for a no-fly zone and safe havens within Syria not only to help protect the Syrians and prevent the constant outflow of refugees, but to, frankly, gain some leverage on both the Syrian government and the Russians so that perhaps we can have the kind of serious negotiation necessary to bring the conflict to an end and go forward on a political track.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, same question.

speaker: WALLACE
text: If we are able to push ISIS out of Mosul and out of Iraq, will -- would you be willing to put U.S. troops in there to prevent their return or something else?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me tell you, Mosul is so sad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when she left, when she took everybody out, we lost Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now we're fighting again to get Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The problem with Mosul and what they wanted to do is they wanted to get the leaders of ISIS who they felt were in Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: About three months ago, I started reading that they want to get the leaders and they're going to attack Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Whatever happened to the element of surprise, OK?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We announce we're going after Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have been reading about going after Mosul now for about -- how long is it, Hillary, three months?

speaker: TRUMP
text: These people have all left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They've all left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The element of surprise.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Douglas MacArthur, George Patton spinning in their graves when they see the stupidity of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we're now fighting for Mosul, that we had.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All she had to do was stay there, and now we're going in to get it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you know who the big winner in Mosul is going to be after we eventually get it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the only reason they did it is because she's running for the office of president and they want to look tough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They want to look good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He violated the red line in the sand, and he made so many mistakes, made all the mistakes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's why we have the great migration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But she wanted to look good for the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So they're going in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But who's going to get Mosul, really?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We'll take Mosul eventually.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the way -- if you look at what's happening, much tougher than they thought.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Much, much tougher.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Much more dangerous.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Going to be more deaths that they thought.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the leaders that we wanted to get are all gone because they're smart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They say, what do we need this for?

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Mosul is going to be a wonderful thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Iran should write us a letter of thank you, just like the really stupid -- the stupidest deal of all time, a deal that's going to give Iran absolutely nuclear weapons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran should write us yet another letter saying thank you very much, because Iran, as I said many years ago, Iran is taking over Iraq, something they've wanted to do forever, but we've made it so easy for them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we're now going to take Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And do you know who's going to be the beneficiary?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh, yeah, they're making -- I mean, they are outsmarting -- look, you're not there, you might be involved in that decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you were there when you took everybody out of Mosul and out of Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You shouldn't have been in Iraq, but you did vote for it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You shouldn't have been in Iraq, but once you were in Iraq, you should have never left the way.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir, your two minutes are up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The point is, the big winner is going to be Iran.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you know, once again, Donald is implying that he didn't support the invasion of Iraq.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I said it was a mistake.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've said that years ago.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He has consistently denied what is...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: a very clear fact that...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: before the invasion, he supported it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, you know, I just want everybody to go Google it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Google "Donald Trump Iraq."

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you will see the dozens of sources which verify that he was for the invasion of Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you can actually hear the audio of him saying that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Now, why does that matter?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, it matters because he has not told the truth about that position.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I guess he believes it makes him look better now to contrast with me because I did vote for it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what's really important here is to understand all the interplay.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Mosul is a Sunni city.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Mosul is on the border of Syria.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, yes, we do need to go after Baghdadi, and -- just like we went after bin Laden, while you were doing "Celebrity Apprentice," and we brought him to justice.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need to go after the leadership.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we need to get rid of them, get rid of their fighters.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There are an estimated several thousand fighters in Mosul.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've been digging underground.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've been prepared to defend.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It's going to be tough fighting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I think we can take back Mosul, and then we can move on into Syria and take back Raqqa.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is what we have to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm just amazed that he seems to think that the Iraqi government and our allies and everybody else launched the attack on Mosul to help me in this election, but that's how Donald thinks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, he always is looking for some conspiracy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chris, we don't gain anything.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He has all the conspiracy theories...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran is taking over Iraq.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, it's...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran is taking over Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't gain anything.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This conspiracy theory, which he's been spewing out for quite some time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If they did it by surprise...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Wait, wait, wait, Secretary Clinton, it's an open discussion.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He says...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We could have gained if they did it by surprise.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary, please let Mr. Trump speak.

speaker: CLINTON
text: unfit, and he proves it every time he talks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, you are the one that's unfit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, WikiLeaks just actually came out -- John Podesta said some horrible things about you, and, boy, was he right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said some beauties.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, Bernie Sanders, he said you have bad judgment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if you think that going into Mosul after we let the world know we're going in, and all of the people that we really wanted -- the leaders -- they're all gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you think that was good, then you do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, John Podesta said you have terrible instincts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bernie Sanders said you have bad judgment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I agree with both.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you should ask Bernie Sanders who he's supporting for president.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And he has said...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Which is a big mistake.

speaker: CLINTON
text: as he has campaigned for me around the country, you are the most dangerous person to run for president in the modern history of America.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think he's right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let's turn to Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, in the last debate, you were both asked about the situation in the Syrian city of Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And I want to follow up on that, because you said several things in that debate which were not true, sir.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You said that Aleppo has basically fallen.

speaker: WALLACE
text: In fact, there -- in fact, there are...

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a catastrophe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean...

speaker: WALLACE
text: It's a catastrophe, but there...

speaker: TRUMP
text: it's a mess.

speaker: WALLACE
text: There are a quarter of...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen it?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen what's happening to Aleppo?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir, if I may finish my question...

speaker: TRUMP
text: OK, so it hasn't fallen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Well, there are a quarter of a million people still living there and being slaughtered.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they are being slaughtered...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Yes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: because of bad decisions.

speaker: WALLACE
text: If I may just finish here, and you also said that -- that Syria and Russia are busy fighting ISIS.

speaker: WALLACE
text: In fact, they have been the ones who've been bombing and shelling eastern Aleppo, and they just announced a humanitarian pause, in effect, admitting that they have been bombing and shelling Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Would you like to clear that up, sir?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, Aleppo is a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a humanitarian nightmare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it has fallen from the -- from any standpoint.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, what do you need, a signed document?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at Aleppo.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is so sad when you see what's happened.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And a lot of this is because of Hillary Clinton, because what's happened is, by fighting Assad, who turned out to be a lot tougher than she thought, and now she's going to say, oh, he loves Assad, she's -- he's just much tougher and much smarter than her and Obama.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And everyone thought he was gone two years ago, three years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He -- he aligned with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He now also aligned with Iran, who we made very powerful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We gave them $150 billion back.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We give them $1.7 billion in cash.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, cash.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bundles of cash as big as this stage.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We gave them $1.7 billion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now they have -- he has aligned with Russia and with Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don't want ISIS, but they have other things, because we're backing -- we're backing rebels.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't know who the rebels are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're giving them lots of money, lots of everything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't know who the rebels are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when and if -- and it's not going to happen, because you have Russia and you have Iran now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But if they ever did overthrow Assad, you might end up with -- as bad as Assad is, and he's a bad guy, but you may very well end up with worse than Assad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If she did nothing, we'd be in much better shape.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And this is what's caused the great migration, where she's taking in tens of thousands of Syrian refugees, who probably in many cases -- not probably, who are definitely...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let me...

speaker: TRUMP
text: in many cases, ISIS-aligned, and we now have them in our country, and wait until you see -- this is going to be the great Trojan horse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And wait until you see what happens in the coming years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Lots of luck, Hillary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thanks a lot for doing a great job.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, you have talked about -- and in the last debate and again today -- that you would impose a no-fly zone to try to protect the people of Aleppo and to stop the killing there.

speaker: WALLACE
text: President Obama has refused to do that because he fears it's going to draw us closer or deeper into the conflict.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And General Joseph Dunford, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, says you impose a no-fly zone, chances are you're going to get into a war -- his words -- with Syria and Russia.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So the question I have is, if you impose a no-fly zone -- first of all, how do you respond to their concerns?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secondly, if you impose a no-fly zone and a Russian plane violates that, does President Clinton shoot that plane down?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, Chris, first of all, I think a no-fly zone could save lives and could hasten the end of the conflict.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm well aware of the really legitimate concerns that you have expressed from both the president and the general.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This would not be done just on the first day.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This would take a lot of negotiation.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it would also take making it clear to the Russians and the Syrians that our purpose here was to provide safe zones on the ground.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've had millions of people leave Syria and those millions of people inside Syria who have been dislocated.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I think we could strike a deal and make it very clear to the Russians and the Syrians that this was something that we believe was in the best interests of the people on the ground in Syria, it would help us with our fight against ISIS.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I want to respond to what Donald said about refugees.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He's made these claims repeatedly.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I am not going to let anyone into this country who is not vetted, who we do not have confidence in.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I am not going to slam the door on women and children.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That picture of that little 4-year-old boy in Aleppo, with the blood coming down his face while he sat in an ambulance, is haunting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And so we are going to do very careful, thorough vetting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That does not solve our internal challenges with ISIS and our need to stop radicalization, to work with American Muslim communities who are on the front lines to identify and prevent attacks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, the killer of the dozens of people at the nightclub in Orlando, the Pulse nightclub, was born in Queens, the same place Donald was born.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So let's be clear about what the threat is and how we are best going to be able to meet it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, yes, some of that threat emanates from over in Syria and Iraq, and we've got to keep fighting, and I will defeat ISIS, and some of it is we have to up our game and be much smarter here at home.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Folks, I want to get into our final segment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I just have to...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Real quick.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's so ridiculous what she -- she will defeat ISIS.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have never let ISIS happen in the first place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And right now, they're in 32 countries.

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have -- wait one second.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They had a cease-fire three weeks ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A cease-fire, the United States, Russia, and Syria.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And during the cease-fire, Russia took over vast swatches of land, and then they said we don't want the cease-fire anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are so outplayed on missiles, on cease-fires.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are outplayed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, she wasn't there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I assume she had nothing to do with it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our country is so outplayed by Putin and Assad, and by the way -- and by Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody can believe how stupid our leadership is.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, Secretary Clinton -- no, we need to move on to our final segment, and that is the national debt, which has not been discussed until tonight.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Our national debt, as a share of the economy, our GDP, is now 77 percent.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That's the highest since just after World War II.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget says, Secretary Clinton, under your plan, debt would rise to 86 percent of GDP over the next 10 years.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, under your plan, they say it would rise to 105 percent of GDP over the next 10 years.

speaker: WALLACE
text: The question is, why are both of you ignoring this problem?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, you go first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I say they're wrong, because I'm going to create tremendous jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we're bringing GDP from, really, 1 percent, which is what it is now, and if she got in, it will be less than zero.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we're bringing it from 1 percent up to 4 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I actually think we can go higher than 4 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think you can go to 5 percent or 6 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if we do, you don't have to bother asking your question, because we have a tremendous machine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will have created a tremendous economic machine once again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To do that, we're taking back jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're not going to let our companies be raided by other countries where we lose all our jobs, we don't make our product anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's very sad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I'm going to create a -- the kind of a country that we were from the standpoint of industry.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We used to be there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've given it up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've become very, very sloppy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've had people that are political hacks making the biggest deals in the world, bigger than companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You take these big companies, these trade deals are far bigger than these companies, and yet we don't use our great leaders, many of whom back me and many of whom back Hillary, I must say.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we don't use those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those are the people -- these are the greatest negotiators in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest businesspeople in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to use them to negotiate our trade deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We use political hacks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We use people that get the position because they gave -- they made a campaign contribution and they're dealing with China and people that are very much smarter than they are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we have to use our great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But that being said, we will create an economic machine the likes of which we haven't seen in many decades.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And people, Chris, will again go back to work and they'll make a lot of money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we'll have companies that will grow and expand and start from new.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, first, when I hear Donald talk like that and know that his slogan is "Make America Great Again," I wonder when he thought America was great.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And before he rushes and says, "You know, before you and President Obama were there," I think it's important to recognize that he has been criticizing our government for decades.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, back in 1987, he took out a $100,000 ad in the New York Times, during the time when President Reagan was president, and basically said exactly what he just said now, that we were the laughingstock of the world.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He was criticizing President Reagan.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is the way Donald thinks about himself, puts himself into, you know, the middle and says, "You know, I alone can fix it," as he said on the convention stage.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But if you look at the debt, which is the issue you asked about, Chris, I pay for everything I'm proposing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I do not add a penny to the national debt.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I take that very seriously, because I do think it's one of the issues we've got to come to grips with.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So when I talk about how we're going to pay for education, how we're going to invest in infrastructure, how we're going to get the cost of prescription drugs down, and a lot of the other issues that people talk to me about all the time, I've made it very clear we are going where the money is.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We are going to ask the wealthy and corporations to pay their fair share.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And there is no evidence whatsoever that that will slow down or diminish our growth.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, I think just the opposite.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We'll have what economists call middle-out growth.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've got to get back to rebuilding the middle class, the families of America.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's where growth will come from.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's why I want to invest in you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want to invest in your family.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think that's the smartest way to grow the economy, to make the economy fairer.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we just have a big disagreement about this.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It may be because of our experiences.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, he started off with his dad as a millionaire...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, yeah, we've heard -- we've heard this before, Hillary.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I started off with -- my dad was a small-business man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've heard this before.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think it -- you know, it's a difference that affects how we see the world and what we want to do with the economy.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Hillary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Could I just respond?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Well, no, sir, because we're running out of time...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because I did disagree with Ronald Reagan very strongly on trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I disagreed with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have been much tougher on trade even then.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I've been waiting for years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody does it right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And frankly, now we're going to do it right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: All right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: The one last area I want to get into with you in this debate is the fact that the biggest driver of our debt is entitlements, which is 60 percent of all federal spending.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Now, the Committee for federal -- a Responsible Federal Budget has looked at both of your plans and they say neither of you has a serious plan that is going to solve the fact that Medicare's going to run out of money in the 2020s, Social Security is going to run out of money in the 2030s, and at that time, recipients are going to take huge cuts in their benefits.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So, in effect, the final question I want to ask you in this regard is -- and let me start with you, Mr. Trump, would President Trump make a deal to save Medicare and Social Security that included both tax increases and benefit cuts, in effect, a grand bargain on entitlements?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm cutting taxes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to grow the economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's going to grow at a record rate of growth.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That's not going to help in the entitlements.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, it's going to totally help you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And one thing we have to do: Repeal and replace the disaster known as Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's destroying our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's destroying our businesses, our small business and our big businesses.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You take a look at the kind of numbers that that will cost us in the year '17, it is a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we don't repeal and replace -- now, it's probably going to die of its own weight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But Obamacare has to go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's -- the premiums are going up 60 percent, 70 percent, 80 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Next year they're going to go up over 100 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I'm really glad that the premiums have started -- at least the people see what's happening, because she wants to keep Obamacare and she wants to make it even worse, and it can't get any worse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bad health care at the most expensive price.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And, Secretary Clinton, same question, because at this point, Social Security and Medicare are going to run out, the trust funds are going to run out of money.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Will you as president entertain -- will you consider a grand bargain, a deal that includes both tax increases and benefit cuts to try to save both programs?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, Chris, I am on record as saying that we need to put more money into the Social Security Trust Fund.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's part of my commitment to raise taxes on the wealthy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: My Social Security payroll contribution will go up, as will Donald's, assuming he can't figure out how to get out of it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what we want to do is to replenish the Social Security Trust Fund...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Such a nasty woman.

speaker: CLINTON
text: by making sure that we have sufficient resources, and that will come from either raising the cap and/or finding other ways to get more money into it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will not cut benefits.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want to enhance benefits for low-income workers and for women who have been disadvantaged by the current Social Security system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what Donald is proposing with these massive tax cuts will result in a $20 trillion additional national debt.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That will have dire consequences for Social Security and Medicare.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I'll say something about the Affordable Care Act, which he wants to repeal.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The Affordable Care Act extended the solvency of the Medicare Trust Fund.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So if repeals it, our Medicare problem gets worse.

speaker: CLINTON
text: What we need to do is go after...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Your husband disagrees with you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: the long-term health care drivers.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've got to get costs down, increase value, emphasize wellness.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have a plan for doing that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think that we will be able to get entitlement spending under control by with more resources and harder decisions.

speaker: WALLACE
text: This is -- this is the final time, probably to both of your delight, that you're going to be on a stage together in this campaign.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I would like to end it on a positive note.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You had not agreed to closing statements, but it seems to me in a funny way that might make it more interesting because you haven't prepared closing statements.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So I'd like you each to take -- and we're going to put a clock up, a minute, as the final question in the final debate, to tell the American people why they should elect you to be the next president.

speaker: WALLACE
text: This is another new mini-segment.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, it's your turn to go first.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, I would like to say to everyone watching tonight that I'm reaching out to all Americans -- Democrats, Republicans, and independents -- because we need everybody to help make our country what it should be, to grow the economy, to make it fairer, to make it work for everyone.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need your talents, your skills, your commitments, your energy, your ambition.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, I've been privileged to see the presidency up close.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I know the awesome responsibility of protecting our country and the incredible opportunity of working to try to make life better for all of you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have made the cause of children and families really my life's work.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's what my mission will be in the presidency.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will stand up for families against powerful interests, against corporations.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will do everything that I can to make sure that you have good jobs, with rising incomes, that your kids have good educations from preschool through college.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I hope you will give me a chance to serve as your president.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, thank you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump?

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's raising the money from the people she wants to control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Doesn't work that way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when I started this campaign, I started it very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's called "Make America Great Again."

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to make America great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a depleted military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It has to be helped, has to be fixed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest people on Earth in our military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't take care of our veterans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We take care of illegal immigrants, people that come into the country illegally, better than we take care of our vets.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That can't happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our policemen and women are disrespected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need law and order, but we need justice, too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our inner cities are a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You get shot walking to the store.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have no education.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have no jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will do more for African-Americans and Latinos than she can ever do in 10 lifetimes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All she's done is talk to the African-Americans and to the Latinos, but they get the vote, and then they come back, they say, we'll see you in four years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are going to make America strong again, and we are going to make America great again, and it has to start now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot take four more years of Barack Obama, and that's what you get when you get her.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Thank you both.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton -- hold on just a moment, folks.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, Mr. Trump, I want to thank you both for participating in all three of these debates.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That brings to an end this year's debates sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

speaker: WALLACE
text: We want to thank the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, and its students for having us.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Now the decision is up to you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: While millions have already voted, Election Day, November 8th, is just 20 days away.

speaker: WALLACE
text: One thing everyone here can agree on: We hope you will go vote.

speaker: WALLACE
text: It is one of the honors and obligations of living in this great country.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Thank you, and good night.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just wanted to begin by mentioning that the nominee for Secretary of the Department of Labor will be Mr.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Alex Acosta.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He has a law degree from Harvard Law School, was a great student.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Former clerk for Justice Samuel Alito.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he has had a tremendous career.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’s a member, and has been a member, of the National Labor Relations Board, and has been through Senate confirmation three times, confirmed — did very, very well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And so Alex, I’ve wished him the best.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We just spoke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he’s going to be — I think he’ll be a tremendous Secretary of Labor.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And also, as you probably heard just a little while ago, Mick Mulvaney, former congressman, has just been approved — weeks late, I have to say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weeks, weeks late.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Office of Management and Budget.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he will be, I think, a fantastic addition.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Paul Singer has just left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, Paul was very much involved with the anti-Trump, or, as they say, "Never Trump." And Paul just left and he’s given us his total support.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it’s all about unification.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re unifying the party, and hopefully we’re going to be able to unify the country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve been talking about that for a long time, but it’s very, very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I want to thank Paul Singer for being here and for coming up to the office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was a very strong opponent, and now he’s a very strong ally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I appreciate that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think I’ll say a few words, and then we’ll take some questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I had this time — we’ve been negotiating a lot of different transactions to save money on contracts that were terrible, including airplane contracts that were out of control and late and terrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just absolutely catastrophic in terms of what was happening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ve done some really good work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re very proud of that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then right after that, you prepare yourselves and we’ll do some questions — unless you have no questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s always a possibility.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m here today to update the American people on the incredible progress that has been made in the last four weeks since my inauguration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have made incredible progress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t think there’s ever been a President elected who, in this short period of time, has done what we’ve done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A new Rasmussen poll, in fact — because the people get it; much of the media doesn’t get it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They actually get it, but they don’t write it — let’s put it that way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But a new Rasmussen poll just came out just a very short while ago, and it has our approval rating at 55 percent and going up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The stock market has hit record numbers, as you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And there has been a tremendous surge of optimism in the business world, which is — to me means something much different than it used to.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It used to mean, oh, that’s good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now it means that’s good for jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very different.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Plants and factories are already starting to move back into the United States and big league — Ford, General Motors, so many of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m making this presentation directly to the American people with the media present, which is an honor to have you this morning, because many of our nation’s reporters and folks will not tell you the truth and will not treat the wonderful people of our country with the respect that they deserve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I hope going forward we can be a little bit different, and maybe get along a little bit better, if that’s possible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe it’s not, and that’s okay too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Unfortunately, much of the media in Washington, D.C., along with New York, Los Angeles, in particular, speaks not for the people but for the special interests and for those profiting off a very, very obviously broken system.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The press has become so dishonest that if we don’t talk about it, we are doing a tremendous disservice to the American people — tremendous disservice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to talk about it to find out what’s going on, because the press honestly is out of control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The level of dishonesty is out of control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I ran for President to represent the citizens of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am here to change the broken system so it serves their families and their communities well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am talking, and really talking, on this very entrenched power structure, and what we’re doing is we’re talking about the power structure, we’re talking about its entrenchment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As a result, the media is going through what they have to go through to oftentimes distort — not all the time — and some of the media is fantastic, I have to say; they’re honest and fantastic.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But much of it is not — the distortion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ll talk about it, and you’ll be able to ask me questions about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’re not going to let it happen, because I’m here again to take my message straight to the people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, our administration inherited many problems across government and across the economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To be honest, I inherited a mess — it’s a mess — at home and abroad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A mess.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jobs are pouring out of the country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You see what’s going on with all of the companies leaving our country, going to Mexico and other places — low-pay, low-wages.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mass instability overseas, no matter where you look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Middle East, a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: North Korea — we’ll take care of it, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to take care of it all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just want to let you know I inherited a mess.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Beginning on day one, our administration went to work to tackle these challenges.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On foreign affairs, we’ve already begun enormously productive talks with many foreign leaders — much of it you’ve covered — to move forward toward stability, security, and peace in the most troubled regions of the world, which there are many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve had great conversations with the United Kingdom — and meetings — Israel, Mexico, Japan, China, and Canada.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Really, really productive conversations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would say far more productive than you would understand.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve even developed a new council with Canada to promote women’s business leaders and entrepreneurs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very important to me, very important to my daughter Ivanka.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have directed our defense community, headed by our great general, now Secretary Mattis — he’s over there now, working very hard — to submit a plan for the defeat of ISIS, a group that celebrates the murder and torture of innocent people in large sections of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It used to be a small group, and now it’s in large sections of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’ve spread like cancer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: ISIS has spread like cancer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Another mess I inherited.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have imposed new sanctions on the nation of Iran, who’s totally taken advantage of our previous administration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they’re the world’s top sponsor of terrorism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re not going to stop until that problem is properly solved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it’s not properly solved now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s one of the worst agreements I’ve ever seen drawn by anybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve ordered plans to begin for the massive rebuilding of the United States military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve had great support from the Senate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve had great support from Congress generally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve pursued this rebuilding in the hopes that we will never have to use this military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I will tell you that is my — I would be so happy if we never had to use it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our country will never have had a military like the military we’re about to build and rebuild.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest people on Earth in our military, but they don’t have the right equipment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And their equipment is old.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I used it, I talked about it at every stop.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Depleted — it’s depleted.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It won’t be depleted for long.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think one of the reasons I’m standing here instead of other people is that, frankly, I talked about we have to have a strong military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to have strong law enforcement also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we do not go abroad in the search of war.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We really are searching for peace, but it’s peace through strength.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At home, we have begun the monumental task of returning the government back to the people on a scale not seen in many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In each of these actions, I’m keeping my promises to the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are campaign promises.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some people are so surprised that we’re having strong borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, that’s what I’ve been talking about for a year and a half — strong borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re so surprised — "oh, you’re having strong borders."

speaker: TRUMP
text: One promise after another after years of politicians lying to you to get elected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, that’s what I’ve been talking about to the press and to everybody else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They lie to the American people in order to get elected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of the things I’m doing probably aren’t popular, but they’re necessary for security and for other reasons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then coming to Washington and pursuing their own interests, which is more important to many politicians.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m here following through on what I pledged to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s all I’m doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I put it out before the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Got 306 Electoral College votes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I wasn’t supposed to get 222.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said there’s no way to get 222; 230 is impossible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Two hundred and seventy, which you need, that was laughable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We got 306 because people came out and voted like they’ve never seen before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So that’s the way it goes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I guess it was the biggest Electoral College win since Ronald Reagan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In other words, the media is trying to attack our administration because they know we are following through on pledges that we made, and they’re not happy about it for whatever reason.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But a lot of people are happy about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, I’ll be in Melbourne, Florida, five o’clock on Saturday, and I heard — just heard that the crowds are massive that want to be there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I turn on the TV, open the newspapers, and I see stories of chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chaos!

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yet, it is the exact opposite.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This administration is running like a fine-tuned machine, despite the fact that I can’t get my Cabinet approved, and they’re outstanding people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Like Senator Dan Coates whose there — one of the most respected men of the Senate — he can’t get approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do you not approve him?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’s been a colleague, highly respected — brilliant guy, great guy, everybody knows it — but waiting for approval.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we have a wonderful group of people that’s working very hard, that’s being very much misrepresented about, and we can’t let that happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So if the Democrats, who have — all you have to do is look at where they are right now — the only thing they can do is delay, because they’ve screwed things up royally, believe me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me list to you some of the things that we’ve done in just a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just got here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I got here with no Cabinet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, each of these actions is a promise I made to the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’ll go over just some of them, and we have a lot happening next week and in the weeks coming.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve withdrawn from the job-killing disaster known as Trans-Pacific Partnership.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to make trade deals, but we’re going to have one-on-one deals — bilateral.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to have one-on-one deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve directed the elimination of regulations that undermine manufacturing, and called for expedited approval of the permits needed for America and American infrastructure, and that means plants, equipment, roads, bridges, factories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People take 10, 15, 20 years to get disapproved for a factory.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They go in for a permit — it’s many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then at the end of the process — they spend tens of millions of dollars on nonsense — and at the end of the process, they get rejected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, they may be rejected with me, but it’s going to be a quick rejection.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s not going to take years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But mostly, it’s going to be an acceptance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want plants built, and we want factories built, and we want the jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don’t want the jobs going to other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve imposed a hiring freeze on nonessential federal workers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve imposed a temporary moratorium on new federal regulations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve issued a game-changing new rule that says for each one new regulation, two old regulations must be eliminated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Makes sense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody has ever seen regulations like we have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you go to other countries and you look at industries they have, and you say, let me see your regulations, and they’re a fraction, just a tiny fraction of what we have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I want regulations because I want safety, I want all environmental situations to be taken properly care of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
