text: But you don’t need four or five or six regulations to take care of the same thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve stood up for the men and women of law enforcement, directing federal agencies to ensure they are protected from crimes of violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve directed the creation of a task force for reducing violent crime in America, including the horrendous situation — take a look at Chicago and others — taking place right now in our inner cities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Horrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve ordered the Department of Homeland Security and Justice to coordinate on a plan to destroy criminal cartels coming into the United States with drugs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re becoming a drug-infested nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Drugs are becoming cheaper than candy bars, and we’re not going to let it happen any longer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve undertaken the most substantial border security measures in a generation to keep our nation and our tax dollars safe, and are now in the process of beginning to build a promised wall on the southern border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Met with General, now Secretary, Kelly yesterday and we’re starting that process.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the wall is going to be a great wall, and it’s going to be a wall negotiated by me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The price is going to come down, just like it has on everything else I’ve negotiated for the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re going to have a wall that works.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re not going to have a wall like they have now, which is either nonexistent or a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve ordered a crackdown on sanctuary cities that refuse to comply with federal law and that harbor criminal aliens, and we’ve ordered an end to the policy of catch and release on the border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No more release, no matter who you are — release.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve begun a nationwide effort to remove criminal aliens, gang members, drug dealers, and others who pose a threat to public safety.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are saving American lives every single day.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The court system has not made it easy for us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ve even created a new office in Homeland Security dedicated to the forgotten American victims of illegal immigrant violence, of which there are many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve taken decisive action to keep radical Islamic terrorists out of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Though parts of our necessary and constitutional actions were blocked by a judge’s, in my opinion, incorrect and unsafe ruling, our administration is working night and day to keep you safe — including reporters safe — and is vigorously defending this lawful order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will not back down from defending our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I got elected on defense of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I keep my campaign promises.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And our citizens will be very happy when they see the result.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They already are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can tell you that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Extreme vetting will be put in place, and it already is in place in many places.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, we had to go quicker than we thought because of the bad decision we received from a circuit that has been overturned at a record number.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve heard 80 percent — I find that hard to believe; that’s just a number I heard — that they’re overturned 80 percent of the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think that circuit is in chaos and that circuit is, frankly, in turmoil.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we are appealing that and we are going further.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re issuing a new executive action next week that will comprehensively protect our country, so we’ll be going along the one path and hopefully winning that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the same time, we will be issuing a new and very comprehensive order to protect our people, and that will be done some time next week, toward the beginning or middle at the latest part.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve also taken steps to begin construction of the Keystone Pipeline and Dakota Access Pipelines — thousands and thousands of jobs — and put new "Buy American" measures in place to require American steel for American pipelines.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In other words, they build a pipeline in this country and we use the powers of government to make that pipeline happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want them to use American steel.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they’re willing to do that, but nobody ever asked before I came along.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Even this order was drawn and they didn’t say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’m reading the order, I’m saying, why aren’t we using American steel?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they said, that’s a good idea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We put it in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To drain the swamp of corruption in Washington, D.C.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve started by imposing a five-year lobbying ban on White House officials and a lifetime ban on lobbying for a foreign government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve begun preparing to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Obamacare is a disaster, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can say, oh, Obamacare — I mean, they fill up our alleys with people that you wonder how they get there, but they’re not the Republican people that our representatives are representing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’ve begun preparing to repeal and replace Obamacare and are deep in the midst of negotiations on a very historic tax reform to bring our jobs back.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re bringing our jobs back to this country big league.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s already happening, but big league.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve also worked to install a Cabinet over the delays and obstruction of Senate Democrats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You’ve seen what they’ve done over the last long number of years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That will be one of the great Cabinets ever assembled in American history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You look at Rex Tillerson — he’s out there negotiating right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: General Mattis I mentioned before, General Kelly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have great, great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mick is with us now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Among their responsibilities will be ending the bleeding of jobs from our country and negotiating fair trade deals for our citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, look, fair trade — not free — fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If a country is taking advantage of us, we’re not going to let that happen anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every country takes advantage of us, almost.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I may be able to find a couple that don’t.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But for the most part, that would be a very tough job for me to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jobs have already started to surge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Since my election, Ford announced it will abandon its plans to build a new factory in Mexico and will instead invest $700 million in Michigan, creating many, many jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Fiat-Chrysler announced it will invest $1 billion in Ohio and Michigan, creating 2,000 new American jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They were with me a week ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know — you were here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: General Motors, likewise, committed to invest billions of dollars in its American manufacturing operation, keeping many jobs here that were going to leave.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if I didn’t get elected, believe me, they would have left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And these jobs and these things that I’m announcing would never have come here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Intel just announced that it will move ahead with a new plant in Arizona that probably was never going to move ahead with.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that will result in at least 10,000 American jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Walmart announced it will create 10,000 jobs in the United States just this year because of our various plans and initiatives.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There will be many, many more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are a few that we’re naming.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Other countries have been taking advantage of us for decades — decades and decades and decades, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re not going to let that happen anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not going to let it happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And one more thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have kept my promise to the American people by nominating a justice of the United States Supreme Court, Judge Neil Gorsuch, who is from my list of 20, and who will be a true defender of our laws and our Constitution — highly respected, should get the votes from the Democrats — you may not see that, but he’ll get there one way or the other.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he should get there the old-fashioned way, and he should get those votes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This last month has represented an unprecedented degree of action on behalf of the great citizens of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, I say it — there has never been a presidency that’s done so much in such a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we haven’t even started the big work that starts early next week.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some very big things are going to be announced next week.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re just getting started.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will be giving a speech, as I said, in Melbourne, Florida, at 5:00 p.m.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I hope to see you there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And with that, I’d just say, God bless America, and let’s take some questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mara.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mara, go ahead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You were cut off pretty violently at our last news conference.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you fire Mike Flynn?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mike Flynn is a fine person, and I asked for his resignation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He respectfully gave it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He is a man who — there was a certain amount of information given to Vice President Pence, who is with us today.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I was not happy with the way that information was given.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He didn’t have to do that, because what he did wasn’t wrong, what he did in terms of the information he saw.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What was wrong was the way that other people, including yourselves in this room, were given that information, because that was classified information that was given illegally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s the real problem.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you can talk all you want about Russia, which was all a fake news, fabricated deal to try and make up for the loss of the Democrats, and the press plays right into it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, I saw a couple of the people that were supposedly involved with all of this — they know nothing about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They weren’t in Russia, they never made a phone call to Russia, they never received a phone call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s all fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s all fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The nice thing is I see it starting to turn, where people are now looking at the illegal, Mara — and I think it’s very important — the illegal giving out classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And let me just tell you, it was given out, like, so much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ll give you an example.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I called, as you know, Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was a very confidential, classified call, but I called Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in calling Mexico, I figured, oh, well, that’s — I spoke to the President of Mexico, had a good call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All of a sudden it’s out for the world to see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s supposed to be secret.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s supposed to be either confidential or classified in that case.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Same thing with Australia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All of a sudden people are finding out exactly what took place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The same thing happened with respect to General Flynn.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everybody saw this, and I’m saying — the first thing I thought of when I heard about it is, how does the press get this information that’s classified?

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do they do it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know why?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because it’s an illegal process, and the press should be ashamed of themselves.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But, more importantly, the people that gave out the information to the press should be ashamed of themselves.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Really ashamed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Why did you keep your Vice President in the dark for almost two weeks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because when I looked at the information, I said, I don’t think he did anything wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If anything, he did something right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was coming into office, he looked at the information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said, huh, that’s fine, that’s what they’re supposed to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re supposed to be — and he didn’t just call Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He called and spoke to, both ways — I think there were 30-some-odd countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’s doing the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The thing is he didn’t tell our Vice President properly, and then he said he didn’t remember.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So either way, it wasn’t very satisfactory to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I have somebody that I think will be outstanding for the position, and that also helps, I think, in the making of my decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he didn’t tell the Vice President of the United States the facts, and then he didn’t remember.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that just wasn’t acceptable to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President Trump, since you brought up Russia, I’m looking for some clarification here.

speaker: QUESTION
text: During the campaign, did anyone from your team communicate with members of the Russian government or Russian intelligence?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And if so, what was the nature of those conversations?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the failing New York Times wrote a big, long front-page story yesterday.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was very much discredited, as you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was — it’s a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the people mentioned in the story — I notice they were on television today saying they never even spoke to Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They weren’t even a part, really — I mean, they were such a minor part — I hadn’t spoken to them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think the one person, I don’t think I’ve ever spoken to him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t think I’ve ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he actually said he was a very low-level member of, I think, a committee for a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t think I ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, it’s possible that I walked into a room and he was sitting there, but I don’t think I ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t talk to him, ever.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he thought it was a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The other person said he never spoke to Russia, never received a call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look at his phone records, et cetera, et cetera.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the other person, people knew that he’d represented various countries, but I don’t think he represented Russia — but knew that he represented various countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s what he does.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, people know that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s Mr. Manafort, who’s, by the way — who’s, by the way, a respected man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’s a respected man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think he represented the Ukraine, or Ukraine government, or somebody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But everybody — people knew that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everybody knew that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So these people — and he said that he has absolutely nothing to do and never has with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he said that very forcefully.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I saw his statement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said it very forcefully.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Most of the papers don’t print it because that’s not good for their stories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So the three people that they talked about all totally deny it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I can tell you, speaking for myself, I own nothing in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no loans in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t have any deals in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: President Putin called me up very nicely to congratulate me on the win of the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He then called me up extremely nicely to congratulate me on the inauguration, which was terrific.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But so did many other leaders — almost all other leaders from almost all other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So that’s the extent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia is fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia — this is fake news put out by the media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The real news is the fact that people, probably from the Obama administration because they’re there — because we have our new people going in place right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, Mike Pompeo is now taking control of the CIA.

speaker: TRUMP
text: James Comey at FBI.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Dan Coats is waiting to be approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, he is a senator, and a highly respected one.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he’s still waiting to be approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our new people are going in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And just while you’re at, because you mentioned this, Wall Street Journal did a story today that was almost as disgraceful as the failing New Times’s story yesterday.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it talked about — you saw it, front page.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So, Director of National Intelligence just put out — acting — a statement: "Any suggestion that the United States intelligence community" — this was just given to us — "is withholding information and not providing the best possible intelligence to the President and his national security team is not true."

speaker: TRUMP
text: So they took this front-page story out of The Wall Street Journal — top — and they just wrote the story is not true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’ll tell you something, I’ll be honest — because I sort of enjoy this back and forth, and I guess I have all my life, but I’ve never seen more dishonest media than, frankly, the political media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I thought the financial media was much better, much more honest.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I will say that I never get phone calls from the media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do they write a story like that in The Wall Street Journal without asking me?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Or how do they write a story in The New York Times, put it on front page?

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was like that story they wrote about the women and me — front page.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Big massive story.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was nasty.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then they called.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said, "We never said that. We like Mr. Trump."

speaker: TRUMP
text: They called up my office — we like Mr. Trump; we never said that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was totally — they totally misrepresented those very wonderful women, I have to tell you — totally misrepresented.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, give us a retraction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They never gave us a retraction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, frankly, I then went on to other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President —

speaker: TRUMP
text: You okay?

speaker: QUESTION
text: I am.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just wanted to get untangled.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Very simply, you said today that you had the biggest electoral margins since Ronald Reagan with 304 or 306 electoral votes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: In fact, President Obama got 365 in 2008.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I’m talking about Republican.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President Obama, 332.

speaker: QUESTION
text: George H.W.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Bush, 426 when he won as President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: So why should Americans trust —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, no, I was told — I was given that information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was just given.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a very, very big margin.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I guess my question is, why should Americans trust you when you have accused the information they receive of being fake when you’re providing information that’s fake?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I don’t know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was given that information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was given — actually, I’ve seen that information around.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it was a very substantial victory.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you agree with that?

speaker: QUESTION
text: You’re the President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s a good answer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, thank you so much.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you tell us in determining that Lieutenant General Flynn — there was no wrongdoing in your mind, what evidence was weighed?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you have the transcripts of these telephone intercepts with Russian officials, particularly Ambassador Kislyak, who he was communicating with?

speaker: QUESTION
text: What evidence did you weigh to determine there was no wrong doing?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And further than that, sir, you’ve said on a couple of occasions this morning that you were going to aggressively pursue the sources of these leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can we ask what you’re doing to do?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And also, we’ve heard about a review of the intelligence community headed by Stephen Feinberg.

speaker: QUESTION
text: What can you tell us about that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, first of all, about that, we now have Dan Coats, hopefully soon Mike Pompeo and James Comey, and they’re in position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I hope that we’ll be able to straighten that out without using anybody else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The gentleman you mentioned is a very talented man, very successful man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he has offered his services, and it’s something we may take advantage of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I don’t think we’ll need that at all because of the fact that I think that we’re going to be able to straighten it out very easily on its own.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the general is concerned, when I first heard about it, I said, huh, that doesn’t sound wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My counsel came — Don McGahn, White House Counsel — and he told me, and I asked him, and he can speak very well for himself.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said he doesn’t think anything is wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He really didn’t think — it was really what happened after that, but he didn’t think anything was done wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t either, because I waited a period of time and I started to think about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, well, I don’t see — to me, he was doing the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The information was provided by — who I don’t know — Sally Yates — and I was a little surprised because I said, doesn’t sound like he did anything wrong there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he did something wrong with respect to the Vice President, and I thought that was not acceptable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the actual making the call — in fact, I’ve watched various programs and I’ve read various articles where he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was very normal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At first, everybody got excited because they thought he did something wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After they thought about it, it turned out he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So — and I do — and, by the way, with all of that being said, I do think he’s a fine man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: On the leaks, sir —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead, finish off, then I’ll get you, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Sorry, what will you do on the leaks?

speaker: QUESTION
text: You have said twice today —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, we’re looking at it very, very seriously.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve gone to all of the folks in charge of the various agencies, and we’re — I’ve actually called the Justice Department to look into the leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those are criminal leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re put out by people either in agencies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think you’ll see it stopping because now we have our people in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, again, we don’t have our people in because we can’t get them approved by the Senate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We just had Jeff Sessions approved in Justice, as an example.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we are looking into that very seriously.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a criminal act.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what I say — when I was called out on Mexico, I was shocked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because all this equipment, all this incredible phone equipment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When I was called out on Mexico, I was — honestly, I was really, really surprised.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I said, you know, it doesn’t make sense, that won’t happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But that wasn’t that important to call, it was fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I could show it to the world and he could show it to the world — the President who is a very fine man, by the way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Same thing with Australia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, that’s terrible that it was leaked but it wasn’t that important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But then I said, what happens when I’m dealing with the problem of North Korea?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What happens when I’m dealing with the problems in the Middle East?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Are you folks going to be reporting all of that very, very confidential information — very important, very — I mean, at the highest level, are you going to be reporting about that too?

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I don’t want classified information getting out to the public.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in a way, that was almost a test.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I’m dealing with Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m dealing with Argentina.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We were dealing on this case with Mike Flynn.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All this information gets put into the Washington Post and gets put into the New York Times.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’m saying, what’s going to happen when I’m dealing on the Middle East?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What’s going to happen when I’m dealing with really, really important subjects like North Korea?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve got to stop it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s why it’s a criminal penalty.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I just want to get you to clarify just a very important point.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you say definitively that nobody on your campaign had any contacts with the Russians during the campaign?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And, on the leaks, is it fake news or are these real leaks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the leaks are real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You’re the one that wrote about them and reported them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, the leaks are real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what they said — you saw it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the leaks are absolutely real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The news is fake because so much of the news is fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So one thing that I felt it was very important to do — and I hope we can correct it, because there is nobody I have more respect for — well, maybe a little bit — than reporters, than good reporters.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very important to me, and especially in this position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t mind bad stories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can handle a bad story better than anybody as long as it’s true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And over a course of time, I’ll make mistakes and you’ll write badly and I’m okay with that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I’m not okay when it is fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, I watch CNN — it’s so much anger and hatred and just the hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t watch it anymore because it’s very good — he’s saying no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s okay, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s okay, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You’ll have your chance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I watch others too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You’re not the only one, so don’t feel badly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think it should be straight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it should be — I think it would be, frankly, more interesting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know how good everybody’s ratings are right now, but I think that actually would be — I think that it would actually be better.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People — I mean, you have a lower approval rate than Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think that’s right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t know, Peter, is that one right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because you know, I think they have lower — I heard, lower than Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But honestly, the public would appreciate it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’d appreciate it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, I don’t mind bad stories when it’s true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have an administration where the Democrats are making it very difficult.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think we’re setting a record, or close to a record in the time of approval of a Cabinet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, the numbers are crazy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When I’m looking — some of them had them approved immediately.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m going forever, and I still have a lot of people that we’re waiting for.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s all they’re doing, is delaying.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you look at Schumer and the mess that he’s got over there, and they have nothing going.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The only thing they can do is delay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, I think they’d be better served by approving and making sure that they’re happy and everybody is good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And sometimes, I mean — I know President Obama lost three or four, and you lose them on the way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think they would be much better served, Jon, if they just went through the process quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is pure delay tactics.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they say it, and everybody understands it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, go ahead, Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
text: The first part of my question on contacts.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Do you definitively say that nobody —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I had nothing to do with it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have nothing to do with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I told you, I have no deals there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, when WikiLeaks, which I had nothing to do with, comes out and happens to give — they’re not giving classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re giving stuff — what was said at an office about Hillary cheating on the debates — which, by the way, nobody mentions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody mentions that Hillary received the questions to the debates.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Can you imagine — seriously, can you imagine if I received the questions?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It would be the electric chair, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He should be put in the electric chair. You would even call for the reinstitution of the death penalty, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe not you, Jon.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, we’ll do you next, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ll do you next.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I just want to clarify one other thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sure.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you direct Mike Flynn to discuss the sanctions with the Russian ambassador?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didn’t.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didn’t.

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible.)

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Off mic.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didn’t.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you fire him because (inaudible)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Excuse me — no, I fired him because of what he said to Mike Pence, very simple.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mike was doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was calling countries and his counterparts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So it certainly would have been okay with me if he did it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would have directed him to do it if I thought he wasn’t doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t direct him but I would have directed him because that’s his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it came out that way — and, in all fairness, I watched Dr.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Charles Krauthammer the other night say he was doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I agreed with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And since then I’ve watched many other people say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didn’t direct him, but I would have directed him if he didn’t do it, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, thank you very much.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And just for the record, we don’t hate you, I don’t hate you.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If you could pass that along.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, ask Jeff Zucker how he got his job, okay?

speaker: QUESTION
text: If I may follow up on some of the questions that have taken place so far, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, not too many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We do have other people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do have other people, and your ratings aren’t as good as some of the other people that are waiting.

speaker: QUESTION
text: They’re pretty good right now, actually.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead, Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If I may ask, sir, you said earlier that WikiLeaks was revealing information about the Hillary Clinton campaign during the election cycle.

speaker: QUESTION
text: You welcomed that at one point.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was okay with it.

speaker: QUESTION
text: You said you loved WikiLeaks.

speaker: QUESTION
text: At another campaign press conference you called on the Russians to find the missing 30,000 emails.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m wondering, sir, if you —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, she was actually missing 33,000, and then that got extended with a whole pile after that, but that’s okay.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Maybe my numbers are off a little bit too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no, but I did say 30,000, but it was actually higher than that.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If I may ask you, sir, it sounds as though you do not have much credibility here when it comes to leaking if that is something that you encouraged in the campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, fair question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ready?

speaker: QUESTION
text: So if I may ask you that — if I may ask a follow-up —

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no, but are you — let me do one at a time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you mind?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So in one case you’re talking about highly classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the other case you’re talking about John Podesta saying bad things about the boss.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will say this: If John Podesta said that about me and he was working for me, I would have fired him so fast your head would have spun.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said terrible things about her.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it wasn’t classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But in one case you’re talking about classified.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Regardless, if you look at the RNC, we had a very strong — at my suggestion — and I give Reince great credit for this — at my suggestion, because I know something about this world, I said I want a very strong defensive mechanism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t want to be hacked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we did that, and you have seen that they tried to hack us and they failed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The DNC did not do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if they did it, they could not have been hacked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they were hacked, and terrible things came.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the only thing that I do think is unfair is some of the things were so — they were — when I heard some of those things, I said — I picked up the papers the next morning, I said, oh, this is going to front page.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It wasn’t even in the papers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, if I had that happen to me, it would be the biggest story in the history of publishing or the head of newspapers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would have been the headline in every newspaper.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, think of it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They gave her the questions for the debate, and she should have reported herself.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Why didn’t Hillary Clinton announce that, "I’m sorry, but I have been given the questions to a debate or a town hall, and I feel that it’s inappropriate, and I want to turn in CNN for not doing a good job"?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And if I may follow up on that, just something that Jonathan Karl was asking you about — you said that the leaks are real, but the news is fake.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I guess I don’t understand.

speaker: QUESTION
text: It seems that there is a disconnect there.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If the information coming from those leaks is real, then how can the stories be fake?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the reporting is fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, look —

speaker: QUESTION
text: And if I may ask — I just want to ask one other question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jim, you know what it is?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Here’s the thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The public isn’t — they read newspapers, they see television, they watch.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don’t know if it’s true or false because they’re not involved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m involved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve been involved with this stuff all my life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I’m involved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I know when you’re telling the truth or when you’re not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just see many, many untruthful things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I tell you what else I see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I see tone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know the word "tone."

speaker: TRUMP
text: The tone is such hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m really not a bad person, by the way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, but the tone is such — I do get good ratings, you have to admit that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The tone is such hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I watched this morning a couple of the networks, and I have to say "Fox & Friends" in the morning, they’re very honorable people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re very — not because they’re good, because they hit me also when I do something wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they have the most honest morning show.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s all I can say.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s the most honest.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the tone, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you look — the hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, sometimes — sometimes somebody gets —

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Off mic.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, you look at your show that goes on at 10 o’clock in the evening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You just take a look at that show.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is a constant hit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The panel is almost always exclusive anti-Trump.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The good news is he doesn’t have good ratings.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the panel is almost exclusive anti-Trump.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the hatred and venom coming from his mouth, the hatred coming from other people on your network.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, I will say this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I watch it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I see it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m amazed by it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I just think you’d be a lot better off — I honestly do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The public gets it, you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, when I go to rallies, they turn around, they start screaming at CNN.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They want to throw their placards at CNN.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think you would do much better by being different.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you just take a look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at some of your shows in the morning and the evening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If a guest comes out and says something positive about me, it’s brutal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, they’ll take this news conference.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m actually having a very good time, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they’ll take this news conference — don’t forget that’s the way I won.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember, I used to give you a news conference every time I made a speech, which was like every day.

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Off mic.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, that’s how I won.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I won with news conferences and probably speeches.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I certainly didn’t win by people listening to you people, that’s for sure.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I am having a good time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tomorrow they will say, Donald Trump rants and raves at the press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m not ranting and raving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m just telling you, you’re dishonest people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But — but I’m not ranting and raving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I love this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m having a good time doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But tomorrow the headlines are going to be: Donald Trump Rants and Raves.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m not ranting and raving.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If I may just —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: One more follow-up because —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Should I let him have a little bit more?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What do you think, Peter?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just because of this —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Peter, should I have let him have a little bit more?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sit down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sit down.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just because of the attack —

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ll get it.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just because of the attack of fake news and attacking our network, I just want to ask you, sir —

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m changing it from fake news, though.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Doesn’t that undermine —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very fake news now.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: QUESTION
text: But aren’t you —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Real news, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Real news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you’re not related to our new —

speaker: QUESTION
text: I am not related, sir, no.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do like the sound of Secretary Acosta, I must say.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I looked — you know, I looked at that name.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, wait a minute, is there any relation there?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Alex Acosta.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m sure you checked that out, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I checked it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said — they said, no, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, do me a favor, go back and check the family tree.

speaker: QUESTION
text: But aren’t you concerned, sir, that you are undermining the people’s faith in the First Amendment freedom of the press, the press in this country when you call stories you don’t like "fake news"?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Why not just say it’s a story I don’t like?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do that.

speaker: QUESTION
text: When you call it fake news, you’re undermining confidence —

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no, I do that.

speaker: QUESTION
text: — in our news media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Here’s the thing.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Isn’t that important?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, I understand — and you’re right about that except this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: See, I know when I should get good and when I should get bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And sometimes I’ll say, wow, that’s going to be a great story, and I’ll get killed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know what’s good and bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’d be a pretty good reporter — not as good as you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I know what’s good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know what’s bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when they change it and make it really bad — something that should be positive.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sometimes something that should be very positive, they’ll make okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’ll even make it negative.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I understand it because I’m there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know what was said.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know who is saying it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So it’s very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, I want to see an honest press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When I started off today by saying that it’s so important to the public to get an honest press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The press — the public doesn’t believe you people anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, maybe I had something to do with that, I don’t know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they don’t believe you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you were straight and really told it like it is, as Howard Cosell used to say, right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Of course, he had some questions also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But if you were straight, I would be your biggest booster, I would be your biggest fan in the world — including bad stories about me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But if you go — as an example, you’re CNN — I mean, it’s story after story after story is bad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I won.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I won.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the other thing: Chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s zero chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are running — this is a fine-tuned machine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Reince happens to be doing a good job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But half of his job is putting out lies by the press.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said to him yesterday, this whole Russia scam that you guys are building so that you don’t talk about the real subject, which is illegal leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I watched him yesterday working so hard to try and get that story proper.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’m saying, here’s my Chief of Staff, a really good guy, did a phenomenal job at RNC.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, we won the election, right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We won the presidency.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We got some senators.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We got some — all over the country, you take a look, he’s done a great job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I said to myself, you know — and I said to somebody that was in the room — I said, you take a look at Reince, he’s working so hard just putting out fires that are fake fires.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re not true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And isn’t that a shame, because he’d rather be working on health care.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’d rather be working on tax reform, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would be your biggest fan in the world if you treated me right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I sort of understand there’s a certain bias, maybe by Jeff or somebody — for whatever reason.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I understand that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you’ve got to be at least a little bit fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s why the public sees it — they see it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They see it’s not fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You take a look at some of your shows and you see the bias and the hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the public is smart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They understand it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, yeah, go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: We have no doubt that your latest story is (inaudible).

speaker: QUESTION
text: But for those who believe that there is something to it, is there anything that you have learned over these last few weeks that you might be able to reveal that might ease their concerns that this isn’t fake news?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And secondly —

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think they don’t believe it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t think the public would.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s why the Rasmussen poll just has me through the roof.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t think they believe it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I guess one of the reasons I’m here today is to tell you the whole Russian thing — that’s a ruse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s a ruse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, by the way, it would be great if we could get along with Russia, just so you understand that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, tomorrow you’ll say, Donald Trump wants to get along with Russia, this is terrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s not terrible — it’s good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had Hillary Clinton try and do a reset.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had Hillary Clinton give Russia 20 percent of the uranium in our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what uranium is, right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s this thing called nuclear weapons and other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Like, lots of things are done with uranium, including some bad things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody talks about that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t do anything for Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve done nothing for Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hillary Clinton gave them 20 percent of our uranium.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hillary Clinton did a reset, remember, with the stupid plastic button that made us all look like a bunch of jerks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Here, take a look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He looked at her like, what the hell is she doing with that cheap plastic button?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hillary Clinton — that was a reset.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It said "reset."

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, if I do that, oh, I’m a bad guy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we could get along with Russia, that’s a positive thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a very talented man, Rex Tillerson, who is going to be meeting with them shortly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I told him, I said, I know politically it’s probably not good for me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hey, the greatest thing I could do is shoot that ship that’s 30 miles offshore right out of the water.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everyone in this country is going to say, oh, it’s so great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s not great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s not great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would love to be able to get along with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, you’ve had a lot of Presidents that haven’t taken that tact.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look where we are now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look where we are now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So, if I can — now, I love to negotiate things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do it really well and all that stuff, but it’s possible I won’t be able to get along with Putin.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe it is.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I want to just tell you, the false reporting by the media, by you people — the false, horrible, fake reporting makes it much harder to make a deal with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And probably Putin said, you know — he’s sitting behind his desk and he’s saying, you know, I see what’s going on in the United States, I follow it closely; it’s got to be impossible for President Trump to ever get along with Russia because of all the pressure he’s got with this fake story.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s a shame.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because if we could get along with Russia — and, by the way, China and Japan and everyone — if we could get along, it would be a positive thing, not a negative thing.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, since you —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tax reform is going to happen fairly quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re doing Obamacare — we’re in final stages.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should be submitting the initial plan in March, early March, I would say.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have to, as you know, statutorily and for reasons of budget, we have to go first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s not like — frankly, the tax would be easier, in my opinion, but for statutory reasons and for budgetary reasons, we have to submit the health care sooner.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’ll be submitting health care sometime in early March, mid-March.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And after that, we’re going to come up — and we’re doing very well on tax reform.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, you mentioned Russia.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Let’s talk about some serious issues that have come up in the last week that you have had to deal with as President of the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: QUESTION
text: You mentioned the vessel, the spy vessel, off the coast of the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not good.

speaker: QUESTION
text: There was a ballistic missile test that many interpreted as a violation —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not good.

speaker: QUESTION
text: — of the agreement between the two countries.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And a Russian plane buzzed a U.S. destroyer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not good.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I listened to you during the campaign —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Excuse me, excuse me, when did it happen?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It happened when — if you were Putin right now, you would say, hey, we’re back to the old games with the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s no way Trump can ever do a deal with us because the — you have to understand, if I was just brutal on Russia right now, just brutal, people would say, you would say, oh, isn’t that wonderful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I know you well enough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then you would say, oh, he was too tough, he shouldn’t have done that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, of all —

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m just trying to find out your orientation to those —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait a minute.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait, wait.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Excuse me just one second.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m just trying to find out what you’re doing to do about them, Mr. President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All of those things that you mentioned are very recent, because probably Putin assumes that he’s not going to be able to make a deal with me because it’s politically not popular for me to make a deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Hillary Clinton tries to reset, it failed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They all tried.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I’m different than those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: How are you interpreting those moves?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And what do you intend to do about them?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just the way I said it.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Have you given Rex Tillerson any advice or counsel on how to deal?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’m so beautifully represented.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m so honored that the Senate approved him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He’s going to be fantastic.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, I think that I’ve already —

speaker: QUESTION
text: Is Putin testing you, do you believe, sir?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I don’t think so.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think Putin probably assumes that he can’t make a deal with me anymore because politically it would be unpopular for a politician to make a deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can’t believe I’m saying I’m a politician, but I guess that’s what I am now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because, look, it would be much easier for me to be tough on Russia, but then we’re not going to make a deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, I don’t know that we’re going to make a deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We might, we might not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it would be much easier for me to be so tough — the tougher I am on Russia, the better.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you know what, I want to do the right thing for the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And to be honest, secondarily, I want to do the right thing for the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If Russia and the United States actually got together and got along — and don’t forget, we’re a very powerful nuclear country and so are they.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s no upside.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re a very powerful nuclear country and so are they.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’ve been briefed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I can tell you, one thing about a briefing that we’re allowed to say because anybody that ever read the most basic book can say it: Nuclear holocaust would be like no other.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re a very powerful nuclear country and so are we.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we have a good relationship with Russia, believe me, that’s a good thing, not a bad thing.

speaker: QUESTION
text: So when you say they’re not good, do you mean that they are —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Who did I say is not good?

speaker: QUESTION
text: No, when I read off the three things that have recently happened and each one of them you said they’re not good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, it’s not good, but they happened.

speaker: QUESTION
text: But do they damage the relationship?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Do they undermine this country’s ability to work with Russia?

speaker: TRUMP
text: They all happened recently, and I understand what they’re doing, because they’re doing the same thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, again, maybe I’m not going to be able to do a deal with Russia, but at least I will have tried.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if I don’t, does anybody really think that Hillary Clinton would be tougher on Russia than Donald Trump?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Does anybody in this room really believe that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I tell you one thing: She tried to make a deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She had the reset.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She gave all the valuable uranium away.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She did other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, they say I’m close to Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hillary Clinton gave away 20 percent of the uranium in the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She’s close to Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I gave — you know what I gave to Russia?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what I gave?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nothing.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can we conclude there will be no response to these particular provocations?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m not going to tell you anything about what response I do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t talk about military response.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t say I’m going into Mosul in four months.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are going to attack Mosul in four months. Then three months later: "We are going to attack Mosul in one month." "Next week, we are going to attack Mosul." In the meantime, Mosul is very, very difficult.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you know why?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because I don’t talk about military, and I don’t talk about certain other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You’re going to be surprised to hear that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, by the way, my whole campaign, I’d say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I don’t have to tell you —

speaker: QUESTION
text: There will be a response?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t want to be one of these guys that say, "Yes, here’s what we’re going to do."

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t have to do that.

speaker: QUESTION
text: There will be a — in other words, there will be a response, Mr. President?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t have to tell you what I’m going to do in North Korea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait a minute.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don’t have to tell you what I’m going to do in North Korea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I don’t have to tell you what I’m going to do with Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know why?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because they shouldn’t know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And eventually you guys are going to get tired of asking that question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So when you ask me, what am I going to do with the ship — the Russian ship, as an example — I’m not going to tell you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But hopefully, I won’t have to do anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I’m not going to tell you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thanks.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can I just ask you — thank you very much, Mr. President — the Trump —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Where are you from?

speaker: QUESTION
text: BBC.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Here’s another beauty.

speaker: QUESTION
text: That’s a good line.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Impartial, free, and fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just like CNN, right?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, on the travel ban — we could banter back and forth.

speaker: QUESTION
text: On the travel ban, would you accept that that was a good example of the smooth running of government, that fine-tuned —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, I do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And let me tell you about the travel —

speaker: QUESTION
text: Were there any mistakes in that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait, wait, wait.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know who you are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just wait.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me tell you about the travel ban.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a very smooth rollout of the travel ban, but we had a bad court.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We got a bad decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a court that’s been overturned — again, maybe wrong, but I think it’s 80 percent of the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A lot.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a bad decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to keep going with that decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to put in a new executive order next week sometime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we had a bad decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s the only thing that was wrong with the travel ban.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You had Delta with a massive problem with their computer system at the airports.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You had some people that were put out there, brought by very nice buses, and they were put out at various locations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Despite that, the only problem that we had is we had a bad court.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a court that gave us what I consider to be, with great respect, a very bad decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very bad for the safety and security of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The rollout was perfect.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, what I wanted to do was do the exact same executive order but said one thing — and I said this to my people: Give them a one-month period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But General Kelly, now Secretary Kelly, said, if you do that, all these people will come in, in the month — the bad ones.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do agree, there are bad people out there, right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re not everybody that’s like you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You have some bad people out there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Kelly said, you can’t do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he was right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As soon as he said it, I said, wow, never thought of it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, how about one week?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said, no good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You got to do it immediately, because if you do it immediately, they don’t have time to come in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, nobody ever reports that, but that’s why we did it quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, if would have done it a month, everything would have been perfect.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The problems is we would have wasted a lot of time, and maybe a lot of lives, because a lot of bad people would have come into our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, in the meantime, we’ve vetting very, very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very, very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we need help, and we need help by getting that executive order passed.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just a brief follow-up.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And if it’s so urgent, why not introduce —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I just was hoping that we could get a yes- or-no answer on one of these questions involving Russia.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you say whether you are aware that anyone who advised your campaign had contacts with Russia during the course of the election?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I told you, General Flynn obviously was dealing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So that’s one person.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he was dealing — as he should have been —

speaker: QUESTION
text: During the election?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no, nobody that I know of.

speaker: QUESTION
text: So you’re not aware of any contacts during the course of the election?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, look, how many times do I have to answer this question?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you just say yes or no on it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia is a ruse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, I know you have to get up and ask a question, so important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia is a ruse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have nothing to do with Russia, haven’t made a phone call to Russia in years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Don’t speak to people from Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not that I wouldn’t, I just have nobody to speak to.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I spoke to Putin twice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He called me on the election — I told you this — and he called me on the inauguration, and a few days ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a very good talk, especially the second one — lasted for a pretty long period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m sure you probably get it because it was classified, so I’m sure everybody in this room perhaps has it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we had a very, very good talk.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have nothing to do with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To the best of my knowledge, no person that I deal with does.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, Manafort has totally denied it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He denied it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, people knew that he was a consultant over in that part of the world for a while, but not for Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think he represented Ukraine or people having to do with Ukraine, or people that — whoever.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But people knew that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everybody knew that.

speaker: QUESTION
text: But in his capacity as your campaign manager, was he in touch with Russian officials during the election?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have — you know what, he said no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can only tell you what he — now, he was replaced long before the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know that, right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was replaced long before the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When all of this stuff started coming out, it came out during the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But Paul Manafort, who’s a good man also, by the way — Paul Manafort was replaced long before the election took place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was only there for a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How much longer should we stay here, folks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Five more minutes, is that okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Five?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, on national security —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait, let’s see, who’s — I want to find a friendly reporter.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Are you a friendly reporter?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Watch how friendly he is.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wait, wait — watch how friendly he is.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: So, first of all, my name is (inaudible) from (inaudible) Magazine.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And (inaudible).

speaker: QUESTION
text: I haven’t seen anybody in my community accuse either yourself or any of the — anyone on your staff of being anti-Semitic.

speaker: QUESTION
text: We have an understanding of (inaudible).

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: QUESTION
text: However, what we are concerned about, and what we haven’t really heard be addressed is an uptick in anti-Semitism and how the government is planning to take care of it.

speaker: QUESTION
text: There have been reports out that 48 bomb threats have been made against Jewish centers all across the country in the last couple of weeks.

speaker: QUESTION
text: There are people who are committing anti-Semitic acts or threatening to —

speaker: TRUMP
text: You see, he said he was going to ask a very simple, easy question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it’s not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not a simple question, not a fair question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, sit down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I understand the rest of your question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So here’s the story, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Number one, I am the least anti-Semitic person that you’ve ever seen in your entire life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Number two, racism — the least racist person.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, we did very well relative to other people running as a Republican.

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Quiet, quiet, quiet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: See, he lied about — he was going to get up and ask a very straight, simple question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So you know, welcome to the world of the media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But let me just tell you something — that I hate the charge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I find it repulsive.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I hate even the question because people that know me — and you heard the Prime Minister, you heard Netanyahu yesterday — did you hear him, Bibi?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said, I’ve known Donald Trump for a long time, and then he said, forget it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So you should take that, instead of having to get up and ask a very insulting question like that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, go ahead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m Lisa from the PBS —

speaker: TRUMP
text: See, it just shows you about the press, but that’s the way the press is.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Lisa Desjardins from the PBS Newshour.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Good.

speaker: QUESTION
text: On national security and immigration, can you give us more details on the executive order you planned for next week, even its broad outlines?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Will it be focused on specific countries?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a very fair question.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And in addition, on the DACA program for immigration, what is your plan?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Do you plan to continue that program or to end it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to show great heart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: DACA is a very, very difficult subject for me, I will tell you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To me, it’s one of the most difficult subjects I have, because you have these incredible kids, in many cases — not in all cases.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In some of the cases they’re having DACA and they’re gang members and they’re drug dealers too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you have some absolutely incredible kids — I would say mostly — they were brought here in such a way — it’s a very, very tough subject.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are going to deal with DACA with heart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have to deal with a lot of politicians, don’t forget, and I have to convince them that what I’m saying is right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I appreciate your understanding on that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the DACA situation is a very, very — it’s a very difficult thing for me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because, you know, I love these kids.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I love kids.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have kids and grandkids.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I find it very, very hard doing what the law says exactly to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, the law is rough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m not talking about new laws.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m talking the existing law is very rough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s very, very rough.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the new order, the new order is going to be very much tailored to what I consider to be a very bad decision, but we can tailor the order to that decision and get just about everything, in some ways more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’re tailoring it now to the decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have some of the best lawyers in the country working on it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the new executive order is being tailored to the decision we got down from the court.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, Melania Trump announced the reopening of the White House Visitors Office.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President, Melania Trump announced the reopening of the White House Visitors Office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And she does a lot of great work for the country as well.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you tell us a little bit about what First Lady Melania Trump does for the country?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And there is a unique level of interest in your administration, so by opening the White House Visitors Office, what does that mean to you?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, that’s what I call a nice question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is very nice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Who are you with?

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m going to start watching.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Melania is terrific.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was here last night.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had dinner with Senator Rubio and his wife, who is, by the way, lovely.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we had a really good discussion about Cuba because we have very similar views on Cuba.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Cuba was very good to me in the Florida election as you know, the Cuban people, Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think that Melania is going to be outstanding.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s right, she just opened up the Visitors Center — in other words, touring of the White House.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She, like others that she’s working with, feels very, very strongly about women’s issues, women’s difficulties, very, very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And she’s a very, very strong advocate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think she’s a great representative for this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And a funny thing happens because she gets so unfairly maligned.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The things they say — I’ve known her for a long time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was a very successful person.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was a very successful model.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She did really well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She would go home at night and didn’t even want to go out with people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was a very private person.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was always the highest quality that you’ll ever find.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the things they say — and I’ve known her for a long time — the things they say are so unfair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And actually, she’s been apologized to, as you know, by various media because they said things that were lies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’d just tell you this: I think she’s going to be a fantastic First Lady.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She’s going to be a tremendous representative of women and of the people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And helping her and working with her will be Ivanka, who is a fabulous person and a fabulous, fabulous woman.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they’re not doing this for money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re not doing this for pay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re doing this because they feel it, both of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Melania goes back and forth, and after Barron finishes school — because it’s hard to take a child out of school with a few months left — she and Barron will be moving over to the White House.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s a very nice question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh, this is going to be a bad question but that’s okay.

speaker: QUESTION
text: No, it’s not going to be a bad question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Good, because I enjoy watching you on television.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Well, thank you so much.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, I need to find out from you — you said something as it relates to inner cities.

speaker: QUESTION
text: That was one of your platforms during your campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Fix the inner cities, yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Fixing the inner cities.

speaker: QUESTION
text: What will be that fix and your urban agenda, as well as your HBCU executive order that’s coming out this afternoon?

speaker: QUESTION
text: See, it wasn’t bad, was it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was very professional and very good.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m very professional.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ll be announcing the order in a little while, and I’d rather let the order speak for itself.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it will be something I think that will be very good for everybody concerned.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’ll talk to you about that after we do the announcement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the inner cities, as you know, I was very strong on the inner cities during the campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it’s probably what got me a much higher percentage of the African American vote than a lot of people thought I was going to get.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We did much higher than people thought I was going to get and I was honored by that, including the Hispanic vote, which was also much higher.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, by the way, if I might add, including the women’s vote, which was much higher than people thought I was going to get.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we are going to be working very hard on the inner cities having to do with education, having to do with crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to try and fix as quickly as possible — you know it takes a long time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s taken 100 years or more for some of these places to evolve, and they evolved many of them very badly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’re going to be working very hard on health and health care; very, very hard on education.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And also, we’re going to working in a stringent way, and a very good way, on crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You go to some of these inner city places, and it’s so sad when you look at the crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You have people — and I’ve seen this, and I’ve sort of witnessed it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, in two cases, I have actually witnessed it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They lock themselves into apartments, petrified to even leave, in the middle of the day.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re living in hell.
