speaker: TRUMP
text: We can’t let that happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re going to be very, very strong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a great question, and it’s a very difficult situation, because it’s been many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s been festering for many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have places in this country that we have to fix.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to help African American people that, for the most part are stuck there — Hispanic American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have Hispanic American people that are in the inner cities, and they’re living in hell.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, you look at the numbers in Chicago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There are two Chicagos, as you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s one Chicago that’s incredible, luxurious and all, and safe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s another Chicago that’s worse than almost any of the places in the Middle East that we talk about, and that you talk about every night on the newscasts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re going to do a lot of work on the inner cities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have great people lined up to help with the inner cities.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Well, when you say — when you say the inner cities, are you going to include the CBC, Mr.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President, in your conversations with your urban agenda, your inner city agenda, as well as your —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Am I going include who?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Are you going to include the Congressional Black Caucus and the Congressional Hispanic Caucus, as well as —

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I would.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I tell you what, do you want to set up the meeting?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you want to set up the meeting?

speaker: QUESTION
text: No, no, no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Are they friends of yours?

speaker: QUESTION
text: I’m just a reporter.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, go ahead, set up the meeting.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I know some of them, but I’m sure they’re watching right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let’s go set up a meeting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would love to meet with the Black Caucus.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it’s great — the Congressional Black Caucus.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it’s great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I actually thought I had a meeting with Congressman Cummings, and he was all excited, and then he said, oh, I can’t move, it might be bad for me politically, I can’t have that meeting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was all set to have the meeting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, we called him and called him, and he was all set.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I spoke to him on the phone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very nice guy.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I hear he wanted that meeting with you as well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He wanted it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we called, called, called, called — they can’t make a meeting with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every day, I walked in, I said, I would like to meet with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because I do want to solve the problem.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he probably was told by Schumer or somebody like that — some other lightweight — he was probably told — he was probably told, don’t meet with Trump, it’s bad politics.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that’s part of the problem of this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, one more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Yes, Mr. President, two questions —

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Two, we can’t handle.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This room can’t handle two.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead, give me the better of your two.

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible)

speaker: QUESTION
text: it’s not about your personality or your beliefs.

speaker: QUESTION
text: We’re talking about (inaudible)

speaker: QUESTION
text: around the country, some of it by supporters in your name.

speaker: QUESTION
text: What do you —

speaker: TRUMP
text: And some of it — and can I be honest with you?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And this has to do with racism and horrible things that are put up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of it written by our opponents.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do know that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you understand that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don’t think anybody would do a thing like that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of the signs you’ll see are not put up by the people that love or like Donald Trump, they’re put up by the other side, and you think it’s like playing it straight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you have some of those signs, and some of that anger is caused by the other side.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’ll do signs and they’ll do drawings that are inappropriate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It won’t be my people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It will be the people on the other side to anger people like you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: You are the President now.

speaker: QUESTION
text: What are you going to do about it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Where is that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh, stand up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can —

speaker: QUESTION
text: What are you going to do about the tensions that have been discussed?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh, I’m working on it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I’m working on it very hard.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Are you going to give a speech?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, no, look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hey, just so you understand, we had a totally divided country for eight years, and long before that, in all fairness to President Obama.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Long before President Obama, we have had a very divided.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn’t come along and divide this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This country was seriously divided before I got here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to work on it very hard.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One of the questions that was asked — I thought it was a very good question — was about the inner cities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, that’s part of it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we’re going to work on education.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to work on lack — you know, we’re going to stop — we’re going to try and stop the crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have great law enforcement officials.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to try and stop crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re not going to try and stop, we’re going to stop crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it’s very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But this isn’t Donald Trump that divided a nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We went eight years with President Obama, and we went many years before President Obama.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We lived in a divided nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I am going to try — I will do everything within my power to fix that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want to thank everybody very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a great honor to be with you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, members of Congress, the First Lady of the United States —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — and citizens of America: Tonight, as we mark the conclusion of our celebration of Black History Month, we are reminded of our nation’s path towards civil rights and the work that still remains to be done.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Recent threats targeting Jewish community centers and vandalism of Jewish cemeteries, as well as last week’s shooting in Kansas City, remind us that while we may be a nation divided on policies, we are a country that stands united in condemning hate and evil in all of its very ugly forms.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Each American generation passes the torch of truth, liberty and justice in an unbroken chain all the way down to the present.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That torch is now in our hands.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we will use it to light up the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am here tonight to deliver a message of unity and strength, and it is a message deeply delivered from my heart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A new chapter —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — of American Greatness is now beginning.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A new national pride is sweeping across our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And a new surge of optimism is placing impossible dreams firmly within our grasp.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What we are witnessing today is the renewal of the American spirit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our allies will find that America is once again ready to lead.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: All the nations of the world — friend or foe — will find that America is strong, America is proud, and America is free.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In nine years, the United States will celebrate the 250th anniversary of our founding — 250 years since the day we declared our independence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It will be one of the great milestones in the history of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But what will America look like as we reach our 250th year?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What kind of country will we leave for our children?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will not allow the mistakes of recent decades past to define the course of our future.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve defended the borders of other nations while leaving our own borders wide open for anyone to cross and for drugs to pour in at a now unprecedented rate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ve spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas, while our infrastructure at home has so badly crumbled.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then, in 2016, the Earth shifted beneath our feet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The rebellion started as a quiet protest, spoken by families of all colors and creeds — families who just wanted a fair shot for their children and a fair hearing for their concerns.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But then the quiet voices became a loud chorus as thousands of citizens now spoke out together, from cities small and large, all across our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because only then can we truly make America great again.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Dying industries will come roaring back to life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Heroic veterans will get the care they so desperately need.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our military will be given the resources its brave warriors so richly deserve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Crumbling infrastructure will be replaced with new roads, bridges, tunnels, airports and railways gleaming across our very, very beautiful land.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our terrible drug epidemic will slow down and, ultimately, stop.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And our neglected inner cities will see a rebirth of hope, safety and opportunity.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Above all else, we will keep our promises to the American people.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s been a little over a month since my inauguration, and I want to take this moment to update the nation on the progress I’ve made in keeping those promises.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Since my election, Ford, Fiat-Chrysler, General Motors, Sprint, Softbank, Lockheed, Intel, Walmart, and many others, have announced that they will invest billions of dollars in the United States and will create tens of thousands of new American jobs.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The stock market has gained almost $3 trillion in value since the election on November 8th, a record.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve saved taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars by bringing down the price of a fantastic — and it is a fantastic — new F-35 jet fighter, and we’ll be saving billions more on contracts all across our government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have placed a hiring freeze on non-military and non-essential federal workers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have begun to drain the swamp of government corruption by imposing a five-year ban on lobbying by executive branch officials and a lifetime ban —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — thank you — and a lifetime ban on becoming lobbyists for a foreign government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have undertaken a historic effort to massively reduce job-crushing regulations, creating a deregulation task force inside of every government agency.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’re imposing a new rule which mandates that for every one new regulation, two old regulations must be eliminated.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to stop the regulations that threaten the future and livelihood of our great coal miners.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have cleared the way for the construction of the Keystone and Dakota Access Pipelines —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — thereby creating tens of thousands of jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’ve issued a new directive that new American pipelines be made with American steel.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have withdrawn the United States from the job-killing Trans-Pacific Partnership.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And with the help of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, we have formed a council with our neighbors in Canada to help ensure that women entrepreneurs have access to the networks, markets and capital they need to start a business and live out their financial dreams.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: To protect our citizens, I have directed the Department of Justice to form a Task Force on Reducing Violent Crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have further ordered the Departments of Homeland Security and Justice, along with the Department of State and the Director of National Intelligence, to coordinate an aggressive strategy to dismantle the criminal cartels that have spread all across our nation.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will stop the drugs from pouring into our country and poisoning our youth, and we will expand treatment for those who have become so badly addicted.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the same time, my administration has answered the pleas of the American people for immigration enforcement and border security.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: By finally enforcing our immigration laws, we will raise wages, help the unemployed, save billions and billions of dollars, and make our communities safer for everyone.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want all Americans to succeed, but that can’t happen in an environment of lawless chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must restore integrity and the rule of law at our borders.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: For that reason, we will soon begin the construction of a great, great wall along our southern border.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As we speak tonight, we are removing gang members, drug dealers, and criminals that threaten our communities and prey on our very innocent citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bad ones are going out as I speak, and as I promised throughout the campaign.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To any in Congress who do not believe we should enforce our laws, I would ask you this one question:  What would you say to the American family that loses their jobs, their income, or their loved one because America refused to uphold its laws and defend its borders?

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our obligation is to serve, protect, and defend the citizens of the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are also taking strong measures to protect our nation from radical Islamic terrorism.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: According to data provided by the Department of Justice, the vast majority of individuals convicted of terrorism and terrorism-related offenses since 9/11 came here from outside of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have seen the attacks at home — from Boston to San Bernardino to the Pentagon, and, yes, even the World Trade Center.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have seen the attacks in France, in Belgium, in Germany, and all over the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is not compassionate, but reckless, to allow uncontrolled entry from places where proper vetting cannot occur.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those given the high honor of admission to the United States should support this country and love its people and its values.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is not compassionate, but reckless to allow uncontrolled entry from places where proper vetting cannot occur.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those given the high honor of admission to the United States should support this country and love its people and its values.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot allow a beachhead of terrorism to form inside America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot allow our nation to become a sanctuary for extremists.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is why my administration has been working on improved vetting procedures, and we will shortly take new steps to keep our nation safe and to keep out those out who will do us harm.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As promised, I directed the Department of Defense to develop a plan to demolish and destroy ISIS — a network of lawless savages that have slaughtered Muslims and Christians, and men, and women, and children of all faiths and all beliefs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will work with our allies, including our friends and allies in the Muslim world, to extinguish this vile enemy from our planet.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have also imposed new sanctions on entities and individuals who support Iran’s ballistic missile program, and reaffirmed our unbreakable alliance with the State of Israel.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Finally, I have kept my promise to appoint a justice to the United States Supreme Court, from my list of 20 judges, who will defend our Constitution.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am greatly honored to have Maureen Scalia with us in the gallery tonight.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Maureen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Her late, great husband, Antonin Scalia, will forever be a symbol of American justice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To fill his seat, we have chosen Judge Neil Gorsuch, a man of incredible skill and deep devotion to the law.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was confirmed unanimously by the Court of Appeals, and I am asking the Senate to swiftly approve his nomination.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, as I outline the next steps we must take as a country, we must honestly acknowledge the circumstances we inherited.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ninety-four million Americans are out of the labor force.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Over 43 million people are now living in poverty, and over 43 million Americans are on food stamps.

speaker: TRUMP
text: More than 1 in 5 people in their prime working years are not working.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the worst financial recovery in 65 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the last eight years, the past administration has put on more new debt than nearly all of the other Presidents combined.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve lost more than one-fourth of our manufacturing jobs since NAFTA was approved, and we’ve lost 60,000 factories since China joined the World Trade Organization in 2001.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our trade deficit in goods with the world last year was nearly $800 billion dollars.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And overseas we have inherited a series of tragic foreign policy disasters.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Solving these and so many other pressing problems will require us to work past the differences of party.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It will require us to tap into the American spirit that has overcome every challenge throughout our long and storied history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to accomplish our goals at home and abroad, we must restart the engine of the American economy — making it easier for companies to do business in the United States, and much, much harder for companies to leave our country.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Right now, American companies are taxed at one of the highest rates anywhere in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My economic team is developing historic tax reform that will reduce the tax rate on our companies so they can compete and thrive anywhere and with anyone.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: It will be a big, big cut.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the same time, we will provide massive tax relief for the middle class.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must create a level playing field for American companies and our workers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to do it.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Currently, when we ship products out of America, many other countries make us pay very high tariffs and taxes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when foreign companies ship their products into America, we charge them nothing, or almost nothing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just met with officials and workers from a great American company, Harley-Davidson.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, they proudly displayed five of their magnificent motorcycles, made in the USA, on the front lawn of the White House.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they wanted me to ride one and I said, “No, thank you.”

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: At our meeting, I asked them, how are you doing, how is business?

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said that it’s good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I asked them further, how are you doing with other countries, mainly international sales?

speaker: TRUMP
text: They told me — without even complaining, because they have been so mistreated for so long that they’ve become used to it — that it’s very hard to do business with other countries because they tax our goods at such a high rate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said that in the case of another country, they taxed their motorcycles at 100 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They weren’t even asking for a change.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I am.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I believe strongly in free trade but it also has to be fair trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s been a long time since we had fair trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The first Republican President, Abraham Lincoln, warned that the “abandonment of the protective policy by the American government… will produce want and ruin among our people.”

speaker: TRUMP
text: Lincoln was right — and it’s time we heeded his advice and his words.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am not going to let America and its great companies and workers be taken advantage of us any longer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have taken advantage of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No longer.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am going to bring back millions of jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Protecting our workers also means reforming our system of legal immigration.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The current, outdated system depresses wages for our poorest workers, and puts great pressure on taxpayers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nations around the world, like Canada, Australia and many others, have a merit-based immigration system.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s a basic principle that those seeking to enter a country ought to be able to support themselves financially.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yet, in America, we do not enforce this rule, straining the very public resources that our poorest citizens rely upon.

speaker: TRUMP
text: According to the National Academy of Sciences, our current immigration system costs America’s taxpayers many billions of dollars a year.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Switching away from this current system of lower-skilled immigration, and instead adopting a merit-based system, we will have so many more benefits.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It will save countless dollars, raise workers’ wages, and help struggling families — including immigrant families — enter the middle class.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they will do it quickly, and they will be very, very happy, indeed.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I believe that real and positive immigration reform is possible, as long as we focus on the following goals:  To improve jobs and wages for Americans; to strengthen our nation’s security; and to restore respect for our laws.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we are guided by the wellbeing of American citizens, then I believe Republicans and Democrats can work together to achieve an outcome that has eluded our country for decades.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Another Republican President, Dwight D. Eisenhower, initiated the last truly great national infrastructure program — the building of the Interstate Highway System.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The time has come for a new program of national rebuilding.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: America has spent approximately six trillion dollars in the Middle East, all this while our infrastructure at home is crumbling.

speaker: TRUMP
text: With this six trillion dollars we could have rebuilt our country – twice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And maybe even three times if we had people who had the ability to negotiate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To launch our national rebuilding, I will be asking Congress to approve legislation that produces a $1 trillion investment in infrastructure of the United States — financed through both public and private capital — creating millions of new jobs.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: This effort will be guided by two core principles:  buy American and hire American.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, I am also calling on this Congress to repeal and replace Obamacare —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — with reforms that expand choice, increase access, lower costs, and, at the same time, provide better healthcare.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mandating every American to buy government-approved health insurance was never the right solution for our country.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The way to make health insurance available to everyone is to lower the cost of health insurance, and that is what we are going do.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Obamacare premiums nationwide have increased by double and triple digits.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As an example, Arizona went up 116 percent last year alone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Governor Matt Bevin of Kentucky just said Obamacare is failing in his State — it is unsustainable and collapsing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One-third of counties have only one insurer, and they are losing them fast.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are losing them so fast.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are leaving, and many Americans have no choice at all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There’s no choice left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember when you were told that you could keep your doctor and keep your plan?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We now know that all of those promises have been totally broken.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Obamacare is collapsing, and we must act decisively to protect all Americans.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Action is not a choice, it is a necessity.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I am calling on all Democrats and Republicans in Congress to work with us to save Americans from this imploding Obamacare disaster.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Here are the principles that should guide the Congress as we move to create a better healthcare system for all Americans:

speaker: TRUMP
text: First, we should ensure that Americans with preexisting conditions have access to coverage, and that we have a stable transition for Americans currently enrolled in the healthcare exchanges.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Secondly, we should help Americans purchase their own coverage through the use of tax credits and expanded Health Savings Accounts — but it must be the plan they want, not the plan forced on them by our government.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thirdly, we should give our great state governors the resources and flexibility they need with Medicaid to make sure no one is left out.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Fourth, we should implement legal reforms that protect patients and doctors from unnecessary costs that drive up the price of insurance, and work to bring down the artificially high price of drugs, and bring them down immediately.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And finally, the time has come to give Americans the freedom to purchase health insurance across state lines —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: which will create a truly competitive national marketplace that will bring costs way down and provide far better care.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everything that is broken in our country can be fixed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every problem can be solved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And every hurting family can find healing and hope.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our citizens deserve this, and so much more — so why not join forces and finally get the job done, and get it done right?

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: On this and so many other things, Democrats and Republicans should get together and unite for the good of our country and for the good of the American people.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration wants to work with members in both parties to make childcare accessible and affordable, to help ensure new parents that they have paid family leave, to invest in women’s health, and to promote clean air and clear water, and to rebuild our military and our infrastructure.

speaker: TRUMP
text: True love for our people requires us to find common ground, to advance the common good, and to cooperate on behalf of every American child who deserves a much brighter future.

speaker: TRUMP
text: An incredible young woman is with us this evening, who should serve as an inspiration to us all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today is Rare Disease Day, and joining us in the gallery is a rare disease survivor, Megan Crowley.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Megan was diagnosed with Pompe disease, a rare and serious illness, when she was 15 months old.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was not expected to live past five.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On receiving this news, Megan’s dad, John, fought with everything he had to save the life of his precious child.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He founded a company to look for a cure, and helped develop the drug that saved Megan’s life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today she is 20 years old and a sophomore at Notre Dame.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Megan’s story is about the unbounded power of a father’s love for a daughter.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our slow and burdensome approval process at the Food and Drug Administration keeps too many advances, like the one that saved Megan’s life, from reaching those in need.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we slash the restraints, not just at the FDA but across our government, then we will be blessed with far more miracles just like Megan.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, our children will grow up in a nation of miracles.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to achieve this future, we must enrich the mind and the souls of every American child.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Education is the civil rights issue of our time.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am calling upon members of both parties to pass an education bill that funds school choice for disadvantaged youth, including millions of African American and Latino children.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: These families should be free to choose the public, private, charter, magnet, religious, or home school that is right for them.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Joining us tonight in the gallery is a remarkable woman, Denisha Merriweather.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As a young girl, Denisha struggled in school and failed third grade twice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But then she was able to enroll in a private center for learning — a great learning center — with the help of a tax credit and a scholarship program.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today, she is the first in her family to graduate, not just from high school, but from college.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Later this year she will get her master’s degree in social work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want all children to be able to break the cycle of poverty just like Denisha.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to break the cycle of poverty, we must also break the cycle of violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The murder rate in 2015 experienced its largest single-year increase in nearly half a century.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In Chicago, more than 4,000 people were shot last year alone, and the murder rate so far this year has been even higher.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is not acceptable in our society.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every American child should be able to grow up in a safe community, to attend a great school, and to have access to a high-paying job.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to create this future, we must work with, not against — not against — the men and women of law enforcement.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must build bridges of cooperation and trust — not drive the wedge of disunity and, really, it’s what it is, division.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s pure, unadulterated division.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to unify.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Police and sheriffs are members of our community.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They’re friends and neighbors, they’re mothers and fathers, sons and daughters — and they leave behind loved ones every day who worry about whether or not they’ll come home safe and sound.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must support the incredible men and women of law enforcement.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we must support the victims of crime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have ordered the Department of Homeland Security to create an office to serve American victims.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The office is called VOICE — Victims of Immigration Crime Engagement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are providing a voice to those who have been ignored by our media and silenced by special interests.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Joining us in the audience tonight are four very brave Americans whose government failed them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Their names are Jamiel Shaw, Susan Oliver, Jenna Oliver, and Jessica Davis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jamiel’s 17-year-old son was viciously murdered by an illegal immigrant gang member who had just been released from prison.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jamiel Shaw, Jr. was an incredible young man, with unlimited potential who was getting ready to go to college where he would have excelled as a great college quarterback.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he never got the chance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: His father, who is in the audience tonight, has become a very good friend of mine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jamiel, thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Also with us are Susan Oliver and Jessica Davis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Their husbands, Deputy Sheriff Danny Oliver and Detective Michael Davis, were slain in the line of duty in California.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They were pillars of their community.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These brave men were viciously gunned down by an illegal immigrant with a criminal record and two prior deportations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Should have never been in our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sitting with Susan is her daughter, Jenna.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jenna, I want you to know that your father was a hero, and that tonight you have the love of an entire country supporting you and praying for you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: To Jamiel, Jenna, Susan and Jessica, I want you to know that we will never stop fighting for justice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Your loved ones will never, ever be forgotten.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will always honor their memory.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Finally, to keep America safe, we must provide the men and women of the United States military with the tools they need to prevent war — if they must — they have to fight and they only have to win.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am sending Congress a budget that rebuilds the military, eliminates the defense sequester —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — and calls for one of the largest increases in national defense spending in American history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My budget will also increase funding for our veterans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our veterans have delivered for this nation, and now we must deliver for them.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The challenges we face as a nation are great, but our people are even greater.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And none are greater or braver than those who fight for America in uniform.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are blessed to be joined tonight by Carryn Owens, the widow of a U.S. Navy Special Operator, Senior Chief William “Ryan” Owens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ryan died as he lived:  a warrior and a hero, battling against terrorism and securing our nation.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just spoke to our great General Mattis, just now, who reconfirmed that — and I quote — “Ryan was a part of a highly successful raid that generated large amounts of vital intelligence that will lead to many more victories in the future against our enemies.”

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ryan’s legacy is etched into eternity.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Ryan is looking down, right now — you know that — and he is very happy because I think he just broke a record.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (LAUGHTER)

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: For as the Bible teaches us, “There is no greater act of love than to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.”

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ryan laid down his life for his friends, for his country, and for our freedom.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we will never forget Ryan.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: To those allies who wonder what kind of a friend America will be, look no further than the heroes who wear our uniform.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our foreign policy calls for a direct, robust and meaningful engagement with the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is American leadership based on vital security interests that we share with our allies all across the globe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We strongly support NATO, an alliance forged through the bonds of two world wars that dethroned fascism, and a Cold War, and defeated communism.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our partners must meet their financial obligations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And now, based on our very strong and frank discussions, they are beginning to do just that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, I can tell you, the money is pouring in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very nice.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We expect our partners — whether in NATO, the Middle East, or in the Pacific — to take a direct and meaningful role in both strategic and military operations, and pay their fair share of the cost.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have to do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will respect historic institutions, but we will respect the foreign rights of all nations, and they have to respect our rights as a nation also.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Free nations are the best vehicle for expressing the will of the people, and America respects the right of all nations to chart their own path.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My job is not to represent the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My job is to represent the United States of America.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we know that America is better off when there is less conflict, not more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must learn from the mistakes of the past.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have seen the war and the destruction that have ravaged and raged throughout the world — all across the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The only long-term solution for these humanitarian disasters, in many cases, is to create the conditions where displaced persons can safely return home and begin the long, long process of rebuilding.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is willing to find new friends, and to forge new partnerships, where shared interests align.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want harmony and stability, not war and conflict.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want peace, wherever peace can be found.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is friends today with former enemies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of our closest allies, decades ago, fought on the opposite side of these terrible, terrible wars.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This history should give us all faith in the possibilities for a better world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hopefully, the 250th year for America will see a world that is more peaceful, more just, and more free.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On our 100th anniversary, in 1876, citizens from across our nation came to Philadelphia to celebrate America’s centennial.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At that celebration, the country’s builders and artists and inventors showed off their wonderful creations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Alexander Graham Bell displayed his telephone for the first time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remington unveiled the first typewriter.

speaker: TRUMP
text: An early attempt was made at electric light.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thomas Edison showed an automatic telegraph and an electric pen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Imagine the wonders our country could know in America’s 250th year.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Think of the marvels we can achieve if we simply set free the dreams of our people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Cures to the illnesses that have always plagued us are not too much to hope.

speaker: TRUMP
text: American footprints on distant worlds are not too big a dream.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Millions lifted from welfare to work is not too much to expect.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And streets where mothers are safe from fear, schools where children learn in peace, and jobs where Americans prosper and grow are not too much to ask.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: When we have all of this, we will have made America greater than ever before — for all Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is our vision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is our mission.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we can only get there together.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are one people, with one destiny.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We all bleed the same blood.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We all salute the same great American flag.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we all are made by the same God.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: When we fulfill this vision, when we celebrate our 250 years of glorious freedom, we will look back on tonight as when this new chapter of American Greatness began.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The time for small thinking is over.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The time for trivial fights is behind us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We just need the courage to share the dreams that fill our hearts, the bravery to express the hopes that stir our souls, and the confidence to turn those hopes and those dreams into action.

speaker: TRUMP

text: So we’ll see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s the fake, fake media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want Americans to be able to purchase the health insurance plans they want, not the plans forced on them by our government.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The House has put forward a plan to repeal and replace Obamacare based on the principles I outlined in my joint address, but let me tell you, we’re going to arbitrate, we’re going to all get together and we’re going to get something done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember this — if we didn’t do it the way we’re doing it, we need 60 votes so we have to get the Democrats involved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They won’t vote, no matter what we do, they’re not going to vote.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re doing it a different way, a complex way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The end result is when you have phase one, phase two, phase three — it’s going to be great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s going to be great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then, we get on to tax reductions, which I like.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The House legislation does so much for you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It gives the states Medicaid flexibility.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And some of the states will take over their healthcare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Governor Rick Scott in Florida said, just send me the money — they run a great plan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have states that are doing great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It gives great flexibility.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: It repeals hundreds of billions of dollars in Obamacare taxes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It provides tax credits to purchase the care that is rightfully theirs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The bill that I will ultimately sign — and that will be a bill where everybody is going to get into the room and we’re going to get it done — we’ll get rid of Obamacare and make healthcare better for you and for your family.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And once this is done, and a step further, we are going to try and put it in phase three — I’m going to work on bringing down the cost of medicine by having a fair and competitive bidding process.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We welcome this healthcare debate and its negotiation, and we’re going to carry it out, and have been carrying it out, in the full light of day — unlike the way Obamacare was passed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember, folks, if we don’t do anything, Obamacare is gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s not like, oh, gee, it’s going to be wonderful in three years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not working.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What we cannot do is to be intimidated by the dishonest attacks from Democratic leaders in Congress who broke the system in the first place and who don’t believe you should be able to make your own healthcare decisions.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am very confident that if we empower the American people we will accomplish incredible things for our country — not just on healthcare, but all across our government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will unlock new frontiers in science and in medicine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will give our children the right to attend the school of their choice, one where they will be taught to love this country and its values.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will create millions and millions of new jobs by lowering taxes on our businesses, and very importantly for our workers, we’re going to lower taxes.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we will fight for the right of every American child to grow up in a safe neighborhood, attend a great school, and to graduate with access to a high-paying job that they love doing.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: No matter our background, no matter our income, no matter our geography, we all share the same home.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We all salute the same flag.

speaker: AUDIENCE
text: USA!

speaker: AUDIENCE
text: USA!

speaker: AUDIENCE

text: It’s time to embrace our glorious American destiny.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Anything we can dream for our country we can achieve for our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All we have to do is tap into that American pride that is swelling our hearts and stirring our souls.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we found that out very recently in our last election — a lot of pride.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are all Americans, and the future truly belongs to us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The future belongs to all of you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is your moment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is your time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is the hour when history is made.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All we have to do is put our own citizens first, and together we will make America strong again.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will make America wealthy again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will make America proud again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will make America safe again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we will make America great again.

text: (APPLAUSE)

text: (APPLAUSE)

text: Thank you very much.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would like to begin by addressing the terrorist attack in Manila.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re closely monitoring the situation, and I will continue to give updates if anything happens during this period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it is really very sad as to what’s going on throughout the world with terror.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our thoughts and our prayers are with all of those affected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Before we discuss the Paris Accord, I’d like to begin with an update on our tremendous — absolutely tremendous — economic progress since Election Day on November 8th.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The economy is starting to come back, and very, very rapidly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ve added $3.3 trillion in stock market value to our economy, and more than a million private sector jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have just returned from a trip overseas where we concluded nearly $350 billion of military and economic development for the United States, creating hundreds of thousands of jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was a very, very successful trip, believe me.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In my meetings at the G7, we have taken historic steps to demand fair and reciprocal trade that gives Americans a level playing field against other nations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re also working very hard for peace in the Middle East, and perhaps even peace between the Israelis and the Palestinians.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our attacks on terrorism are greatly stepped up — and you see that, you see it all over — from the previous administration, including getting many other countries to make major contributions to the fight against terror.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Big, big contributions are being made by countries that weren’t doing so much in the form of contribution.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One by one, we are keeping the promises I made to the American people during my campaign for President –- whether it’s cutting job-killing regulations; appointing and confirming a tremendous Supreme Court justice; putting in place tough new ethics rules; achieving a record reduction in illegal immigration on our southern border; or bringing jobs, plants, and factories back into the United States at numbers which no one until this point thought even possible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And believe me, we’ve just begun.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The fruits of our labor will be seen very shortly even more so.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On these issues and so many more, we’re following through on our commitments.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I don’t want anything to get in our way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am fighting every day for the great people of this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Therefore, in order to fulfill my solemn duty to protect America and its citizens, the United States will withdraw from the Paris Climate Accord —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — thank you, thank you — but begin negotiations to reenter either the Paris Accord or a really entirely new transaction on terms that are fair to the United States, its businesses, its workers, its people, its taxpayers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re getting out.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we will start to negotiate, and we will see if we can make a deal that’s fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if we can, that’s great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if we can’t, that’s fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As President, I can put no other consideration before the wellbeing of American citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Paris Climate Accord is simply the latest example of Washington entering into an agreement that disadvantages the United States to the exclusive benefit of other countries, leaving American workers — who I love — and taxpayers to absorb the cost in terms of lost jobs, lower wages, shuttered factories, and vastly diminished economic production.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thus, as of today, the United States will cease all implementation of the non-binding Paris Accord and the draconian financial and economic burdens the agreement imposes on our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This includes ending the implementation of the nationally determined contribution and, very importantly, the Green Climate Fund which is costing the United States a vast fortune.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Compliance with the terms of the Paris Accord and the onerous energy restrictions it has placed on the United States could cost America as much as 2.7 million lost jobs by 2025 according to the National Economic Research Associates.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This includes 440,000 fewer manufacturing jobs — not what we need — believe me, this is not what we need — including automobile jobs, and the further decimation of vital American industries on which countless communities rely.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They rely for so much, and we would be giving them so little.

speaker: TRUMP
text: According to this same study, by 2040, compliance with the commitments put into place by the previous administration would cut production for the following sectors:  paper down 12 percent; cement down 23 percent; iron and steel down 38 percent; coal — and I happen to love the coal miners — down 86 percent; natural gas down 31 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The cost to the economy at this time would be close to $3 trillion in lost GDP and 6.5 million industrial jobs, while households would have $7,000 less income and, in many cases, much worse than that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not only does this deal subject our citizens to harsh economic restrictions, it fails to live up to our environmental ideals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As someone who cares deeply about the environment, which I do, I cannot in good conscience support a deal that punishes the United States — which is what it does -– the world’s leader in environmental protection, while imposing no meaningful obligations on the world’s leading polluters.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For example, under the agreement, China will be able to increase these emissions by a staggering number of years — 13.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They can do whatever they want for 13 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: India makes its participation contingent on receiving billions and billions and billions of dollars in foreign aid from developed countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There are many other examples.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the bottom line is that the Paris Accord is very unfair, at the highest level, to the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Further, while the current agreement effectively blocks the development of clean coal in America — which it does, and the mines are starting to open up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re having a big opening in two weeks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Pennsylvania, Ohio, West Virginia, so many places.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A big opening of a brand-new mine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s unheard of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For many, many years, that hasn’t happened.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They asked me if I’d go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m going to try.

speaker: TRUMP
text: China will be allowed to build hundreds of additional coal plants.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we can’t build the plants, but they can, according to this agreement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: India will be allowed to double its coal production by 2020.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Think of it:  India can double their coal production.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re supposed to get rid of ours.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Even Europe is allowed to continue construction of coal plants.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In short, the agreement doesn’t eliminate coal jobs, it just transfers those jobs out of America and the United States, and ships them to foreign countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This agreement is less about the climate and more about other countries gaining a financial advantage over the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The rest of the world applauded when we signed the Paris Agreement — they went wild; they were so happy — for the simple reason that it put our country, the United States of America, which we all love, at a very, very big economic disadvantage.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A cynic would say the obvious reason for economic competitors and their wish to see us remain in the agreement is so that we continue to suffer this self-inflicted major economic wound.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We would find it very hard to compete with other countries from other parts of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have among the most abundant energy reserves on the planet, sufficient to lift millions of America’s poorest workers out of poverty.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yet, under this agreement, we are effectively putting these reserves under lock and key, taking away the great wealth of our nation — it’s great wealth, it’s phenomenal wealth; not so long ago, we had no idea we had such wealth — and leaving millions and millions of families trapped in poverty and joblessness.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The agreement is a massive redistribution of United States wealth to other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At 1 percent growth, renewable sources of energy can meet some of our domestic demand, but at 3 or 4 percent growth, which I expect, we need all forms of available American energy, or our country —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — will be at grave risk of brownouts and blackouts, our businesses will come to a halt in many cases, and the American family will suffer the consequences in the form of lost jobs and a very diminished quality of life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Even if the Paris Agreement were implemented in full, with total compliance from all nations, it is estimated it would only produce a two-tenths of one degree — think of that; this much — Celsius reduction in global temperature by the year 2100.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tiny, tiny amount.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, 14 days of carbon emissions from China alone would wipe out the gains from America — and this is an incredible statistic — would totally wipe out the gains from America’s expected reductions in the year 2030, after we have had to spend billions and billions of dollars, lost jobs, closed factories, and suffered much higher energy costs for our businesses and for our homes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As the Wall Street Journal wrote this morning:  "The reality is that withdrawing is in America’s economic interest and won’t matter much to the climate."

speaker: TRUMP
text: The United States, under the Trump administration, will continue to be the cleanest and most environmentally friendly country on Earth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’ll be the cleanest.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to have the cleanest air.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to have the cleanest water.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will be environmentally friendly, but we’re not going to put our businesses out of work and we’re not going to lose our jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’re going to grow; we’re going to grow rapidly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think you just read — it just came out minutes ago, the small business report — small businesses as of just now are booming, hiring people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One of the best reports they’ve seen in many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m willing to immediately work with Democratic leaders to either negotiate our way back into Paris, under the terms that are fair to the United States and its workers, or to negotiate a new deal that protects our country and its taxpayers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: So if the obstructionists want to get together with me, let’s make them non-obstructionists.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will all sit down, and we will get back into the deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ll make it good, and we won’t be closing up our factories, and we won’t be losing our jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we’ll sit down with the Democrats and all of the people that represent either the Paris Accord or something that we can do that’s much better than the Paris Accord.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think the people of our country will be thrilled, and I think then the people of the world will be thrilled.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But until we do that, we’re out of the agreement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will work to ensure that America remains the world’s leader on environmental issues, but under a framework that is fair and where the burdens and responsibilities are equally shared among the many nations all around the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No responsible leader can put the workers — and the people — of their country at this debilitating and tremendous disadvantage.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The fact that the Paris deal hamstrings the United States, while empowering some of the world’s top polluting countries, should dispel any doubt as to the real reason why foreign lobbyists wish to keep our magnificent country tied up and bound down by this agreement:  It’s to give their country an economic edge over the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s not going to happen while I’m President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’m sorry.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: My job as President is to do everything within my power to give America a level playing field and to create the economic, regulatory and tax structures that make America the most prosperous and productive country on Earth, and with the highest standard of living and the highest standard of environmental protection.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our tax bill is moving along in Congress, and I believe it’s doing very well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think a lot of people will be very pleasantly surprised.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Republicans are working very, very hard.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We’d love to have support from the Democrats, but we may have to go it alone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it’s going very well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Paris Agreement handicaps the United States economy in order to win praise from the very foreign capitals and global activists that have long sought to gain wealth at our country’s expense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don’t put America first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do, and I always will.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: The same nations asking us to stay in the agreement are the countries that have collectively cost America trillions of dollars through tough trade practices and, in many cases, lax contributions to our critical military alliance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You see what’s happening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s pretty obvious to those that want to keep an open mind.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At what point does America get demeaned?

speaker: TRUMP
text: At what point do they start laughing at us as a country?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want fair treatment for its citizens, and we want fair treatment for our taxpayers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don’t want other leaders and other countries laughing at us anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they won’t be.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They won’t be.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was elected to represent the citizens of Pittsburgh, not Paris.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I promised I would exit or renegotiate any deal which fails to serve America’s interests.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many trade deals will soon be under renegotiation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very rarely do we have a deal that works for this country, but they’ll soon be under renegotiation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The process has begun from day one.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But now we’re down to business.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Beyond the severe energy restrictions inflicted by the Paris Accord, it includes yet another scheme to redistribute wealth out of the United States through the so-called Green Climate Fund — nice name — which calls for developed countries to send $100 billion to developing countries all on top of America’s existing and massive foreign aid payments.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we’re going to be paying billions and billions and billions of dollars, and we’re already way ahead of anybody else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many of the other countries haven’t spent anything, and many of them will never pay one dime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Green Fund would likely obligate the United States to commit potentially tens of billions of dollars of which the United States has already handed over $1 billion — nobody else is even close; most of them haven’t even paid anything — including funds raided out of America’s budget for the war against terrorism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s where they came.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Believe me, they didn’t come from me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They came just before I came into office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And not good the way they took the money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In 2015, the United Nation’s departing top climate officials reportedly described the $100 billion per year as "peanuts," and stated that "the $100 billion is the tail that wags the dog."

speaker: TRUMP
text: In 2015, the Green Climate Fund’s executive director reportedly stated that estimated funding needed would increase to $450 billion per year after 2020.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And nobody even knows where the money is going to.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody has been able to say, where is it going to?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Of course, the world’s top polluters have no affirmative obligations under the Green Fund, which we terminated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is $20 trillion in debt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Cash-strapped cities cannot hire enough police officers or fix vital infrastructure.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Millions of our citizens are out of work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And yet, under the Paris Accord, billions of dollars that ought to be invested right here in America will be sent to the very countries that have taken our factories and our jobs away from us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So think of that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There are serious legal and constitutional issues as well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Foreign leaders in Europe, Asia, and across the world should not have more to say with respect to the U.S. economy than our own citizens and their elected representatives.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thus, our withdrawal from the agreement represents a reassertion of America’s sovereignty.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our Constitution is unique among all the nations of the world, and it is my highest obligation and greatest honor to protect it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I will.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Staying in the agreement could also pose serious obstacles for the United States as we begin the process of unlocking the restrictions on America’s abundant energy reserves, which we have started very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It would once have been unthinkable that an international agreement could prevent the United States from conducting its own domestic economic affairs, but this is the new reality we face if we do not leave the agreement or if we do not negotiate a far better deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The risks grow as historically these agreements only tend to become more and more ambitious over time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In other words, the Paris framework is a starting point — as bad as it is — not an end point.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And exiting the agreement protects the United States from future intrusions on the United States’ sovereignty and massive future legal liability.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Believe me, we have massive legal liability if we stay in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As President, I have one obligation, and that obligation is to the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Paris Accord would undermine our economy, hamstring our workers, weaken our sovereignty, impose unacceptable legal risks, and put us at a permanent disadvantage to the other countries of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is time to exit the Paris Accord —

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: — and time to pursue a new deal that protects the environment, our companies, our citizens, and our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is time to put Youngstown, Ohio, Detroit, Michigan, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania — along with many, many other locations within our great country — before Paris, France.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is time to make America great again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I’d like to ask Scott Pruitt, who most of you know and respect, as I do, just to say a few words.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You just want massive tax cuts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s what you want.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That’s the only reason you’re going so wild.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it’s wonderful to be back in the great state of Indiana.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What a place.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want to thank Senator Todd Young, Senator Joe Donnelly, Representative Jackie Walorski, Representative Susan Brooks, and Representative Mike [sic] Messer for joining us today.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much for being here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Appreciate it.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I also want to thank members of my economic team, Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Director Gary Cohn, for joining us, as well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We appreciate it.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me begin by saying that our hearts and prayers go out to the people of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands who are suffering in the wake of yet another catastrophic hurricane.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, their island was virtually destroyed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Federal agencies are working closely with local partners to help these communities get back on their feet as soon as possible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Texas, Florida, and Louisiana are doing great, and the recovery process is happening very, very quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will be going down to Puerto Rico next week to get an on-the-ground briefing about the disaster recovery and to see all of our great first responders and to meet a lot of the people who were so affected by these storms.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are with you now, I tell them, and we will be there every step of the way until this job is done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is truly catastrophic what happened in Puerto Rico.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And massive amounts of water, food, and supplies, by the way, are being delivered on an hourly basis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It’s something that nobody has ever seen before from this country, I can tell you that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I’m very proud of all of the folks that have worked so hard in FEMA, all of our first responders, all of our police that have gone to the island because their police force has been so badly affected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And many of their policemen — in fact, most of the police people have lost their homes, and it’s been a tough go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we are — we’re going to get it back.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Before we go on to discuss the largest tax cut in our county’s history, I also want to provide a brief update on healthcare.

speaker: TRUMP

speaker: TRUMP

speaker: TRUMP
text: But speaking of reconciliation, the Republican Senate needs to get rid of the filibuster rule, which is blocking so many great legislative reforms the American people badly want and deserve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: By the way, the Democrats, if they had the opportunity, which hopefully they won’t for many, many years, they would get rid of it on day one.

speaker: TRUMP
